reviews.text: My first time ordering the filet mignon and it was a horrible experience. Not only was it burned and looked old it was tasteless <br><br>We ordered this on Thursday 11/12/20 at around 8 pm our server was this guy from Philadelphia.. <br><br>Never again
Excellent dinner and great pice!!<br><br>I highly recommend this Restaurant!!<br><br>Nice restaurant to eat at!!<br><br>Great service!!!<br><br>Will definitely be back!!!

I went to this Cheesecake Factory location for my birthday during my Las Vegas trip. Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants but I was honestly disappointed after coming to this location. I made a reservation a month in advanced for 8:00 and was seated almost 50 minutes late, all because the host forgot about us. I&#39;m not completely blaming her: I work minimum wage, you&#39;re doing a lot of things at once and sometimes mistakes are made. But it was honestly really frustrating watching families of 5+ being seated before us that arrived after us, with no reservation. I probably would&#39;ve been seated faster if I didn&#39;t have a reservation. If I hadn&#39;t gotten up to check on my table I probably wouldn&#39;t have been seated at all. By the time we were seated my mood was completely killed. <br><br>The only thing that perked me up a little was my waitress Fabiola. If it weren&#39;t for my amazing waitress Fabiola, who was very friendly and attentive, and the delicious food, this would be a one star review. It&#39;s unfortunate to have had such a damper ending on an exciting and adventurous birthday in Vegas.

I am only rating this place three stars because although my food was good, I had to send it back because it was cold when  I got it, and when our server took it back to heat up the only thing hot was the plate, so not a good way to celebrate my birthday,  and to top it of when Brandon our server offered me a piece of cheesecake for my birthday I took it as ok he wants to make up for bringing me cold food, Nope, he charged me for it....Never again cheesecake factory.

Cheesecake factory is my favorite all-time restaurant. I travel a lot and cheesecake factory is still my go to. I like the fact that this location had upstairs. However the food here was just OK. Cheesecake factory can be a hit or miss sometimes. This restaurant was a miss. My pasta was dry and very salty. And my friend food was not prepared correctly.

Don&#39;t have much to say, the food was good as expected, the seating was prompt, and the Service was great! Didn&#39;t get her name but she was a slender Asian American looking young lady. We asked her for a few extras and she promptly served us with a smile and laughed at my wife&#39;s and I corny jokes. The fried calamari was great and the shrimp scampi and steak Diane was delicious. We took a fudge cake Linda or something like that home and it was amazing.

This is located in the very back of the shopping center in Caesar&#39;s Palace next to a giant fountain.  It&#39;s always super packed so expect a wait.  <br>As with all Cheesecake Factory menu&#39;s, they have a ton of food.  I tend to stick to the chicken nachos.  They are really good and although i never seem to make a dent, i keep going back to the same thing.<br>I was here right before September and they had their holiday cheesecakes available.  The pumpkin was AMAZING!!  So glad i got to try it.

Unfortunately, my party of 5 ate here before running the Vegas marathon. Why so unfortunate? 3 of us who ate the exact same thing here got food poisoning. Can you imagine running for hours with tummy troubles? Not fun. Week ruined. <br><br>Aside from us getting sick, they also messed up my dish TWICE, making it so incredibly salty it made us all gag. They offered to remake it for me a third time but No thank you! This caused me to eat from the (dirty) dishes the other two marathon runners  ordered. <br><br>We will never eat at Cheesecake Factory ever again. <br><br>The service is not at fault. Waitress was lovely. The manager apologised about my twice messed up dish. The people are fine but you guys need to step up on quality assurance. Gross. So very gross.

I just love this place so much. This is located inside the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace. If you&#39;re staying at Caesars, you have to walk through the Casino to get to the Shops. We stayed at Caesars and this was so convenient. The one in Edina, MN is also beautiful. <br><br>My husband and I came here for Sunday brunch and it was so delicious. We ordered the cult classic appetizer Avocado Eggrolls, and coffees to start. I got the Pancakes, 2 eggs and bacon. He got the Monte Christo - a phenomenal French Toast club-style sandwich with ham, bacon, scrambled eggs, swiss cheese - and it comes with strawberry preserves on the side. It was huge, I had to help him finish it!  Probably one of the best things we ate at this year&#39;s Vegas retreat. <br><br>At the end of the day, we walked back there just to get dessert. We shared the Celebration Cheesecake, a melt in your mouth combination of pink and blue cheesecakes with vanilla cake layers, topped with fresh cream and sprinkles. We sat down by the Fountains of the Gods inside the Forum Shops and ate our cake. It was an outstanding day. When in Rome, do as the Romans do.

Only had appetizers and drinks on the patio but enjoyed our experience. My Mia Tai was good, our beet and avacado salad was tasty. We wanted the chicken taquitos but they were out of them mid day for whatever reason. We also had the chicken potstickers which were ok. <br>Great place to sit and watch the world go by.

I went to this location prior to the new Covid restrictions.  They weren&#39;t that busy. I checked in with the hostess and she pointed to an area in front and told me to wait. I waited 20 min while she made sure at least 10 other parties got a table and were seated. Apparently overweight single older females aren&#39;t a priority to her. And when I went back and asked her about where I was on the list, she told me in a very snotty manner to get back to my spot and wait. The only other time I was treated this badly was at Cheesecake Factory in Beverly Hills, where we didn&#39;t fit that LA socialite mold. It was as clear to us then as this experience was to me at this location that they don&#39;t want business from the likes of people like me.

I wanted to eat here. I called and the lady who answered the phone said she would transfer me to the front to make a reservation. I sat on hold for 6 minutes but no one ever took my call. My wife called and they put her through to the front while I waited on hold. One star for wasting my time.

Our Anniversary dinner was absolutely amazing. Thank you cheesecake factor for yet again another delicious meal and we even saved room for dessert this time.  Thanx to Fabiola for being such an amazing.  She was so friendly.  Keep up the great work Cheesecake we will see you again on our next trip. A definite must stop.

Simply put, dollar for dollar it&#39;s the best chain restaurant by far.  Amazing menu. We recommend the barbecue chicken salad (best salad from any chain restaurant) and avocado toast (same opinion as the BBQ chicken salad). <br><br>Weekend brunch is a must-try as well.  How could anyone go to a pancake joint if this is an alternative option beats us.

This Miso Salmon is single-handedly saving the Cheesecake Factory! Lol. Well maybe not entirely but it&#39;s certainly close. I&#39;ve heard multiple people tell me that I was missing out and I sure was! The Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp was my go to meal here but not anymore. Miso Salmon FOREVER! #ashsaidit

We come here 3 times this week <br><br>FAN <br><br>The food is great. So many choices.  Clean place.  <br><br>But. The service.   There is nothing like that. They so nice. They are so polite.  3/4 different servers.  Every one was so nice. Polite. Wow. <br><br>And cakes.  I love it. <br><br>If you never been. It&#39;s a must. <br><br>Just be ready to eat a lot
Ordered a Cobb salad and it come with a vinaigrette, no option to change the dressing on the website. My husband was very disappointed .

I ate here for lunch on 11/07/20. I had the chicken fettuccine and now I&#39;m sick in my hotel room throwing up the chicken. It&#39;s the only meal I had today and hurt my stomach as soon as I ate it. I felt sick thinking I have COVID but the relief of me throwing up the pasta out of my stomach has made me feel so much better, so probably got a touch of food poisoning from undercooked chicken

They have tables open, and people waiting outside for 20 minutes on a Monday night, and the stupid high school drop out up front gives me attitude!!! That&#39;s what I get for supporting local businesses during these difficult times
Great food menu items and fun for the kids customer seevice was perfect from the server but the girl hostess could be a little nicer and make everyone feel welcomed.

I&#39;ll start off by saying the only downer here is waited about 20 minutes but we did get the outdoor/indoor in Caesar&#39;s Palace. I definitely had the lemon cheesecake which was on point I must say!<br><br>I love the ambience and the view of the fish tank if you see it in the outer foyer. Nothing special at this Cheesecake but definitely not any negatives at this place as well. The server and the hostess were very welcoming and the food was as expected. Always a good place after you spend so much money shopping at Caesars Palace!

Went to celebrate my boyfriend&#39;s birthday at the Cheesecake factory.  We went around 8pm expecting a long wait time, but were seated quickly within 5mins. The server was friendly and service was pretty fast for a Friday night. <br>I got the Chicken Madeira,  which comes with mashed potatoes, sauteed mushrooms, and asparagus. It was yummy, the chicken was cooked to perfection and the sauce was good. My bf got the Chicken Fettuccini and loved it.<br>For dessert, we got the Oreo Cheesecake and we left full and satisfied. <br><br>TIP: Ask for their wheat bread. So good!

I went to the Cheesecake Factory with my girlfriend and we were having some issues with the food which at first made our experience sub par and almost has us leaving, BUT our server Hannah who had dark hair and bangs  (if there are other Hannah&#39;s working there) she turned everything into an amazing experience for us. She really went out of her way for us in so many ways (especially my girlfriend) and as a boyfriend you never want to take your girl out for a bad experience, but our waitress Hannah really did her best and made my girlfriend happy and our dinner became a great overall experience. I think in these times people should really appreciate the servers more. They truly are the people running the machinery and in the end they are what decides if you walk out there with a smile or frown. I decided to write this review because it made my night with my girl so much better and set us up for an amazing night after our dinner as well. Thank you Hannah you really made a difference! We will definitely be coming back (and ask for you as our waitress again). <br>PS. Always tip your waitor/waitress accordingly. If you can afford going to a restaurant in these tough financial times, remember that these workers were out of work for a long period of this pandemic. If you can&#39;t tip well stay home ;) <br>I thought I would just add that to my review since In the end we started out unhappy but the service was what turned it into a amazing stay.

When I&#39;m in Vegas I always have to hit up Cheesecake Factory.. it&#39;s a MUST. With their huge menu selection it&#39;s almost impossible to decide what to eat! I try and get something different each time I go, and honestly I&#39;m never disappointed. Usually when places have big menus it&#39;s never really a good sign - but not here !<br><br>It took us about 25 minutes for 2 to get seated, and that was at 9:30 at night. Not too bad but unless you have the patience to wait then maybe this isn&#39;t the right place to eat. <br><br>service was good and food came out at a reasonable wait time (especially for how busy it was!) But always will hit up this place when I come back to Vegas

just had lunch here in the forum shops at caesars palace at the cheesecake factory ‼.. all i gotta say is i&#39;m never disappointed with the service or food. the staff is super friendly &amp; the foo is alwayz bomb‼.. the best part is,, the cheesecakes... nothing else compares ‼.. i will definitely be back again for the fish tacos‼..
Great food  I always get the filet mignon!! <br>&amp; calamari  as an appetizer is delicious
Great meal with friends tonight. Chicken Marsala lettuce wraps and salmon so yummy! Steak and potatoes so yummy. Great service and quick seating

The most terrible cheesecake factory ever.  We deicded that after a long day on the strip we would end the night by going to the cheesecake factory. We were a group of 8 people with one person on a scooter becuase they had a broken foot. We walked up and they took down our name and the wait wasnt to bad. At most we waited about 5 minutes, which in our eyes is very duable. Here is where it goes down south.<br><br>Once we were seated no one ever came to us to greet us or take out order. We sat there annoyed, hungry, and sleepy for about 15 minutes before someone even came. Then when he did come, he took our drink orders and some appitizer orders and took about another 10 minutes to come back with our drinks. Mind you 6 out of 8 people ordered water the other two coke. You can not tell me that it takes 10 minutes to get some water from the tap!<br><br>When the waiter finally did return with our drinks he took our order. At this point half the group took their meal togo because we were tired of sitting there playing the waiting game. It took us about 45 minutes to get our food. Which took entirely to long. We saw families sit down after us by like 30 minutes and get their food before us. While we waited, we never got any bread like the rest of the tables. We asked for some, but never reccieved any. Along with that, we had one person ask about the oil they use because of food allergys. The waiter said that he would check and get back to us and he never did. So one person in our group didnt even order anything becuase he failed to get back to us with important health related information. <br><br>Once the food did come, we were ready to go. Some meals ended up being nice and hot while others cold and undercooked. My sister ordered shrimp alfredo and her shrimp were were raw and cold. She ate one shrimp because it looked off and no long be hold it was raw and cold. She immedietly sent her plate back, when she did the waiter caught a bad attitude with her with was not neccessary at all. We waited for our checks, paid and then left.  We were sitting there for roughly 2.5 hours for us not to even eat our food at the resturant. This is the most unprofessional resturant that I have been to, along with that having rude and unknowledgeable staff.  I DO NOT RECCOMEND this to anyone. While some had a good experiance, we did not. If you want to go out to eat, go somewhere else, but this is not the place togo. <br><br>I included a picture of two of the meals before they were boxed up and taken home.

Normally love Cheesecake Factory for their consistent food and service. This location let us down. Didn&#39;t wait long for a table but then the whole rest of the meal draaaaagged. Took us nearly an hour and a half for our meal, and not because we were slow to order or eat.<br><br>The appetizer took nearly twenty minutes to come out and it was lukewarm and tasted undercooked. After waiting fifteen minutes from when we finished our food for server to check on us, we asked for boxes and cheesecake to go. That alone took another ten minutes to bring out.<br><br>They didn&#39;t seem nearly busy enough to justify this level of slowness.<br><br>Update: I decided to ask for the manager and she at least apologized for the slow service, stating that part of it was because we were seated upstairs vs. downstairs where the kitchen is. She also took the appetizer off our bill and comped the cheesecake. We were appreciative.

75 Minutes after we sat. Still waiting for our dinner. Not one staff member has checked on us in 20- Minutes. Came here to celebrate. Everyone ordered a drink, which has now been consumed, and unable to be refilled due to no one checking in on us. <br><br>Pretty much a damper on the evening and a tradition we have kept for a few years. Honest mistake? Maybe. But, at least check in from time to time. A second Drink might have helped us wait for food. <br><br>One plate actually just came cold. Interesting. <br><br>Highly Unsatisfied. Would recommend many of the other great establishments with incredible chefs in this city. This place has dropped the ball. And well, thank you, next.

I have been to CF a few times before on dates and outings with friends, even just for lunch. It&#39;s always fairly busy, but the service is typically pretty good. It&#39;s basically an &#34;upscale&#34; Applebee&#39;s if you&#39;ve never been; nothing spectacular, but definitely good. <br>On June 28, 2020 myself and 9 other went to celebrate my sisters birthday and if this was not the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at a dining facility! We showed up at 7:22 and placed drink and app orders by 7:35. Great. Did not receive ANY of our items until after 8 o&#39;clock. Not even the drinks. MIND YOU ITS NOT EVEN BUSY FOR ONCE. And my friends crab bites were brought out cold. Twice. By the time we got our apps we figured our entrees and placed those orders. We did not receive those items until after 9 pm. And we didn&#39;t even receive them all. OVER AN HOUR WAIT FOR FOOD and we didn&#39;t get it all. Mind you, not everyone ordered entrees. 2 of our party order additional drinks that we had to remind our server that we ordered and when he finally brought them he said &#34;the bartender is backed up&#34; but it only took him 1 minute to come back with those drinks so I am fully convinced he just forgot to get them. It&#39;s 9:30 and we&#39;re still waiting on the birthday girls entree after reminding our server about that as well. At this point I&#39;m fed up due to the aforementioned PLUS unmentioned things, and I ask for the manager.<br>This manager was AWESOME and the only reason I will ever return to this location if ever prompted. Her name is Dawn and she deserves all of her professional flowers. Not only did she completely take over our table, but she went above and beyond to take care of our meal. We had reservations for a karaoke room at 10pm (which we obviously ended up being late for), so she personally bagged and brought us our desserts free of charge plus ensured our bill was accurately charged and included an additional appeasement discount. She listened to our experience and did everything she could and then some to revive some of her restaurants good name. Again, Dawn is the only reason I would ever return to CF.

Great place to get a salad that you know will not be overpriced. The salad I ordered was very healthy and huge. It was piled up like a volcano and it was fun to eat my way through the various layers. The flavours seemed to work together.<br><br>The price was fair and the margaritas were well priced and yummy. I was satisfied with the value for the money for the dish I ordered. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is a great place to go if you know what dishes you like. It&#39;s not an exotic or creative menu but pretty consistent in quality, value and delivery based on my experience.

My husband and I ate here today. Our waitress was amazing . My meal wasn&#39;t prepared properly but our waitress and manager took care of it all with no problems. Appetizer and my husband meal was wonderful . We will be back .

Woooooooow! We waited 35 minutes for our food and they brought out two COLD entrees. And the nachos were burned to boot! See pic. The waiter then had the audacity to yell across the restaurant &#34;IT&#39;S NOT MY FAULT&#34;. Well, dude, who&#39;s fault is it then? obama&#39;s? LOL
The food was good. I had a ribeye steak. It had little bit too fat but was delicious regardless. Sweet potatoe fries were good and the waiter was friendly and very helpful.

My boyfriend and I went on a Friday night around 7pm and the wait was only 10 minutes for two. AVOCADO EGG-ROLLS are a must have! Our waitress was very nice and the service was fast. I believe her name was Heidi. My only complaint is that we were sitting right next to the hostess podium and when people came in to get their name on the list they would hover right above us. <br><br>Food was served correctly and hot. I love Cheesecake Factory!

SWEET!<br><br>With all the calories that could be potentially consumed at any TCF location, dining at TCF is a bonafide treat (for me, personally).  My mom and I both love cheesecake, and therefore we couldn&#39;t pass up the chance of dining at this location.<br><br>LOCATION / SETTING:<br>The Forum Shops at Caesars Palace near the aquarium.  Restaurant is 2 floors, with some seating on the first floor having views of the aquarium and Atlantis Show.  <br><br>side NOTE:  <br>We actually visited this location twice during our vacation last month.  The first time for take out cheesecake from their counter, and the 2nd for lunch on our last day.<br><br>FOOD:<br>The menu is enormous!  So much choices/selections....and that&#39;s just the dessert section.  The menu has appetizers, salads, sandwiches, entrees, pastas, etc.  Even for the most finicky of eaters, I&#39;m sure there must be something on this menu that is appealing.<br><br>After some time, we decided on the egg roll sampler, while my mom chose the Shepard&#39;s Pie, my brother selected the super oxidant salad, and I ordered the BBQ chicken salad (lunch portion).  For drinks, my mom and I ordered coffee, and my brother was all smiles when the server confirmed they could make him a Bloody Mary.<br><br>The egg rolls were ok.  They were a bit more oily than I expected, but I shouldn&#39;t have been surprised since we ordered fried food for an appetizer.  Not sure if I would order this again.  Thereafter, our entrees were delivered to the table, and I am so happy there were lunch sizes available because my salad seemed (to me) as if it were a FULL SIZE order.  It was massive!  It was just enough for myself, but unfortunately I couldn&#39;t bring myself to finish it.  If I were to order this again on a future visit, I would probably ask for no fried onions/onion rings (it just seemed a bit excessive to me).  My brother enjoyed his salad and finished the entire serving.  My mom, on the other hand, found her choice to just be mediocre.  In hindsight, she admitted she should have chosen something else such as a salad or sandwich.  <br><br>Lastly, the cheesecake (like always) was very satisfying.  We ordered (at the take out counter) one slice each of the key lime and pumpkin seasonal cheesecake.  I felt we needed to order the pumpkin since its a seasonal flavor, and we both concurred that both slices weren&#39;t overly sweet.<br><br>SERVICE:<br>Very exceptional.  The hostess was friendly and seated us immediately (we arrived at around 1045 am on a Saturday; the restaurant opened at 10am that day).  Our server was a friendly and knowledgeable woman, who answered all our menu questions, and periodically checked on us throughout our meal.  <br><br>One last thing to mention:  the staff at the take out counter were polite and very efficient.  <br><br>BOTTOM LINE:<br>Convenient (take a break while shopping!) and spacious location.  Great service.  Delicious desserts!  Yay Cheesecake!

Whenever we&#39;re in Vegas we try to stop and have dinner here. Great food but service could have been better. We ordered salmon and Alfredo fettuccine. They messed up on the pasta but salmon was excellent and priced reasonably.  Overall great food decent prices. For a weekday, we waited 15 min for patio seating, sweet!!!

I like the skinnylicious menu. It didn&#39;t taste skinny, and it was good to eat a salad after all the buffet food. I had a turkey sandwich and the bread and meat was all good, not dry and well seasoned.

Cheesecake Factory is my absolute favorite . I always get the Santa Fe salad for starters along with the avocado spring rolls , and my entree will vary. Cheesecakes are delicious my favorite is tiramisu

I love the cheese cake factory and I frequent to it in  my hometown , but I can say that I would never ever come back to this one again. First of all waiter had a horrible attitude.  I understand it&#39;s Christmas Day but he just didn&#39;t want to be at work and we were a party of eight and we all noticed it. <br>It took 45 minutes for us to get our food. We ordered three filet minion steaks, and one burger . One nachos .. <br>all the meat was burned crisp, we send the steaks back and they told us it would be another 25 minutes, so that was not cool . Our waiter told us it&#39;s because it&#39;s on a char grill .. please we eat at the Cheesecake Factory often and we all eat steak often .. our 21 year old eat hers because she was starving but it was tough. The food  unacceptable. <br>All other food was decent . <br><br>So I would not waste your time at this location . Spend your time elsewhere.

I come to this location a few times a month and so do many of my coworkers (we work in the mall)). Usually the service is good and quick but today I don&#39;t think I will be patronizing this particular location again. My coworker went in around 3 and they had a 20 minute wait for bread. She told them she couldn&#39;t wait but would send her coworker there later for the (complimentary bread). I went in and hour later and called ahead of time and they still weren&#39;t sure if they had bread made... they kept transferring me so after a 5 minutes wait on the phone I decided to just go in. <br><br>When I get there the cashier Maria starts acting brand new like she didn&#39;t know my coworker and like she didn&#39;t know I called. She charged me for it. I was upset because it was a courtesy since they didn&#39;t have any earlier. She asks for the receipt, which they usually don&#39;t even give you a copy of the receipt, unless you specifically ask for one. <br><br>I paid for my bread and left with no receipt mind you. Honestly it was just the principal, not the money. I&#39;m just so disappointed in the level of service that was provided to me. I always tip and am polite. I honestly will never eat here again and it&#39;s so unfortunate because there are only so many options in the mall.

Went to this Cheesecake Factory location while on vacation in Las Vegas with my family last week. Normally, I&#39;ve had a great experience at other Cheesecake Factory locations, but this one was despicable. <br><br>Went up to be seated, was told it would be a 5-10 minute wait for a table of four, and was given a buzzer to be called when my table was ready. I thought &#34;great! This is a short wait!&#34; But, was I wrong. <br><br>I was called up by the buzzer and greeted by Jack. He took my buzzer and told me to wait just behind the counter and someone will seat me in just a moment. Stood with my family as more parties of four came up and were seated right away, yet we were ignored. This went on for about 10-15 minutes. <br><br>I went up to speak with Jack again. He was speaking with another customer at the time and when he was finished, he COMPLETELY IGNORED ME, and began talking to another customer who just walked up. <br><br>My father got angry and spoke with someone else who was seating people. When he started talking with her, Jack turned and said, with MUCH attitude I might add, &#34;you&#39;ll be seated shortly, folks.&#34; I gave him that attitude right back and told him we&#39;ve been ignored and a number of parties of four have been seated before us when we were here first. As I was saying this sentence, he started talking over me and repeating that we&#39;ll be seated in a moment. Finally, we were seated, with NO apology from anyone about what happened. <br><br>Only reason I&#39;m giving two stars instead of one is because our waitress was fantastic. I&#39;m sad I didn&#39;t get her name, but she had all our food and drinks out so quickly, it was wonderful. <br><br>I hope someone from management sees this and teaches Jack how to properly treat and speak to customers.

The best and the worst.<br><br>My rating of 5 is only for the food and the service. As always, our food was delicious. We enjoyed our pancakes, omelette, and coffee very much.  Our waiter, Joseph, was excellent. He made good suggestions on what to order and always was around to refill our coffee and water glasses. He is an asset to the restaurant.<br><br>Now, a zero rating for the hostess, Chelsea, and the manager, Raven.  We came to the restaurant because they were one of the few who were taking reservations. I made the reservation the day before on line. I received a receipt on my phone that we had a reservation.  In the morning, I called to verify the time of our reservation. It was 11. The person who answered was Raven and she said she would have a table for us at 11.   We arrived at 10:55 and there were about 30 people in line. I went to the front desk and told Chelsea that we had a reservation for 11. She told me to go to the end of the line. I said, &#34;Doesn&#39;t a reservation mean anything?&#34; She looked at me in an annoyed way, and said in a very snippy voice, loudly,&#34; I said you have to wait in line.&#34; I asked to see the manager who was Raven. She was dismissive too. I told her she had told me that she would have a table for me at 11 when I spoke to her in the morning.  She told me that she had said that but I still would have to wait in line.  By now, it was 11:20 and Chelsea had allowed in and seated 10 parties who did not have reservations and were waiting in line. I told Raven if she had told me I would have to wait in line, I would have come earlier.  They let 4 more parties in and seated us at 11:30.  I don&#39;t know what the reservation policy is but the attitude of these 2 employees was really rude and even more upsetting than the wait.  We eat at many Cheesecake Factories around the country when we travel and we have never encountered such horrible and insulting treatment.

Hubby and I were enjoying a date night without the kiddo after a long crazy week and decided we needed to eat at the one and only chain restaurant we absolutely adore - The Cheesecake Factory. It was a Tuesday night around 9:30p and there was a 40 minute wait. Between exploring nearby shops and good conversation the time passed quickly. We were sat at a table near the back on the first floor and our waiter was with us right away. He took awesome care of us all evening - some of the best service I&#39;ve had at a Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>We recently learned how much we love their loaded Nachos. So we ordered them with the &#34;spicy&#34; chicken to share. For dessert, we tried to new chocolate coffee cheesecake and also the Godiva brownie sundae (one of our go-tos). The new Cheesecake had great flavor, but not quite the same texture as other cheesecakes.....it felt like it stuck to my mouth in different way. Overall it was good, but next time I think we&#39;ll go back to one of our favorites (Oreo or Reese&#39;s).  <br><br>There&#39;s so much good food here! I know the menu can be over-whelming. I&#39;m not much for their pizzas and I feel their burgers are just fine. I usually prefer a crazy Appetizer (any of the awesome egg rolls or fried Mac &amp; cheese balls) or a salad if I want something light (Cobb or Greek).

My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed our lunch yesterday. The drinks and food were delicious as usual. Alexandra was our server. She has a great accent and I learned that she is originally from the Czech Republic. Even  though she is new, she did a great job and is an amazing server! She is friendly, accommodating, efficient and checked on us multiple times. I will definitely return to this Cheesecake Factory and request her as my server!

We eat at CCF almost everywhere we go, and from all the times, our server tonight was the best. Best service we&#39;ve ever received. She was quick, efficient, friendly, and didn&#39;t leave our cups empty at all! She made my birthday a memorable one for the books! Thank you Melissa!!

A friendly and familiar place was a nice break in a sea of new, one-of, famous chef places to choose from here in Vegas. Somehow it still took us 20min to decide what we wanted (insert laugh here). <br>Tucked in the back of Ceasar&#39;s Palace, behind the Fall of Atlantis show (giant marble statues of the God&#39;s that come to life), the view was great for people watching and the patio, although indoors was much brighter than inside.<br>We both settled on Omelet&#39;s. Me, the California, sub all cheeses for goat cheese, and my mom got the Build Your Own. After having walked the strip for six miles we both went with water for hydration.<br>Our waitress was so kind and prompt. Our food was delicious and the portions did not disappoint. The prices are more than your typical Cheesecake Factory, but I guess that&#39;s expected in Vegas.

Did a Door Dash order from Cheesecake Factory in Los Vegas, while the Door Dash service was great the dinners were a mess. The kids meal was missing the drink, the Meatloaf was burnt and I mean burnt had I been in the restaurant it would have been sent back I also ordered a slice of their cheesecake and they decided to sent something else. We checked out printed order and they just screwed up you would think they would do a better job while we&#39;re trying g to support them during this virus. Door Dash you were outstanding where you could have issued a credit for the one meal and desert you credited our entire order 5 meals. That&#39;s not stepping up to the plate that&#39;s hitting a homerun sorry Cheesecake Factory you just lost a customer!

Happy 400th Review and I am dedicating #400 to The Cheesecake Factory. <br>Why The Cheesecake Factory? <br>The Reason: This Cheesecake Factory location holds special memories I will never ever forget, I celebrated most of my anniversaries here at this Cheesecake Factory location, the very first celebration was our 7th, which I remember like it was yesterday. We have been back every year,since our 7th. That&#39;s many anniversaries here!! <br><br>This recent anniversary was our 21st Anniversary and I wanted to keep the tradition going. <br>Although we do have a Cheesecake factory in Hawaii, which I need the energy, to get to Waikiki and with the very long wait, I don&#39;t really visit this location back home often. <br>This is why, I really look forward to February, our Anniversary. <br><br>I Really do enjoy all my visits to this Cheesecake Factory location, located in the Forum Shops at Caesars adjacent to Caesars Palace on the Las Vegas Strip far north side of the mall. This Cheesecake Factory is HUGE with 2 levels. During my recent visit, we got our table right away after checking in with the hostess, we went after the dinner rush, which was close to 8 pm. <br><br>We always end up ordering our usual, but I still like to glance thru the famous 10 page storybook menu with 200 menu items. I like to see what new items are available. The loaded baked potato tots sounded tempting so I also got that along with our usual. <br><br>Here is what we always order, our anniversary tradition. <br><br>Fried Calamari, came with garlic dip and cocktail sauce, They make the best fried calamari, cooked just right, light and crisp. <br><br>Did you know that Cheesecake Factory has Miso Salmon? <br>Our entrée are the Miso Salmon X 2, fresh salmon marinated in miso, served with snow peas and white rice. I always request well done on my salmon. The miso sauce, rice, &amp; snow peas just went so great together. We enjoyed this entrée. <br><br>Loaded baked potato tots, Crispy potato tots filled with cheese, bacon, &amp; green onion, served with sour cream. I didn&#39;t care for this tots, I was expecting tots with the stuff separate, like nachos style. It was too rich, we didn&#39;t finish this tots. <br><br>We always get our alcoholic beverage and we need to make room for cheesecake. Never leave Cheesecake Factory with out eating a cheesecake, that&#39;s too crazy!<br><br>The grand finale : cheesecake, deciding on what cheesecake to get is the hard part, with tons of flavors to choose from, My wonderful hubby always lets me choose, we are too stuffed to have our own cheesecake.  For our anniversary cake, I went with the salted caramel, enjoying every delicious bite. <br><br>Note: for any celebration, Cheesecake factory will decorate your cheesecake, free of charge.<br><br>About Cheesecake Factory: <br>*Established in 1978 by Evelyn and Oscar Overton<br>*The first Cheesecake Factory was founded in 1978, in Beverly Hills, California, by David Overton<br>*There are over 150 Cheesecake Factory locations<br>*The success of The Cheesecake Factory is a great American success story<br><br>Overall, we always enjoy our visits here at this Cheesecake location and looking forward to many more! Thank you Cheesecake factory for a memorable celebration. <br><br>Happy 400th &amp; Happy 21st!!<br><br>#41/100 for 2017
Used yelp to make reservations for my girlfriend and my mother for her birthday. Food was excellent, service was very good and as always the aesthetics make it a nice place to be.

Super surprised at the lackluster service and food. We&#39;ve eaten at dozens of Cheesecake Factory restaurants across the country. This location inside of Caesar&#39;s Palace is absolutely awful. Dirty plates, cold Tex Mex Rolls, and the waitress Christa NEVER brought bread to our table, even after we asked for it. We sat outside, in the mall area and were forced to listen to some stupid fountain fire show where a dragon emerged from the aquarium.  It&#39;s a Tuesday night, they could do better!

I know this is chain restaurant and have eaten at Coral Gables &amp; Aventura locations several times but this Cheesecake is located inside the Cesar&#39;s Forum shops where diners can watch the Fall of Atlantis show for free. We sat on the terrace and it was great for people watching.<br><br>Ordered the Smoke House BBQ burger (Smoked Bacon, Cheddar, Onion Strings, Ranch BBQ). This burger was pretty enormous and mighty tasty. Bacon &amp; onion rings were crispy. The patty was juicy medium. It came with fries so this was definitely a filling lunch for $12. My friend got the Factory Burger and said that it was also good.<br><br>Service was swift and polite. Got seated in 5 minutes and food came in a timely manner. We were there on a Monday so weekends are probably a lot busier from reading other reviews.
Food was amazing!  Service was a bit slow but with everyone getting back into it I understand.

I tried cheesecake  factory many times  but this time different experience. Just void this place.never never again. Manager whs so rude <br>.so unprofessional .he didn&#39;t give us our table after 1:15 minutes wait.he couldn&#39;t able manage to able put two table together because he want to put smaller table first. Over all never never again. I wish 0 was option.

Server was nice but tonight the restaurant was understaffed.  We waited over an hour and a half to be seated and for our food and this really ruined the whole experience.  What&#39;s funny is that Cheesecake is usually managed properly enough to avoid these rookie mistakes but it was either a blunder tonight or the company decided to go down hill.  With our food nowhere in sight, we ended up walking out but I did at least tell the managers our plight and they seemed genuinely concerned.  However, my party was already past the outside aquarium so we just decided to continue.  <br><br>I worked in restaurants where executives decide to boost profits by cutting labor necessary to make customers happy.  If that&#39;s the case here, there are thousands of other places we will be happy to go instead.

So my son and I decided to give this place a shot while in Caesars. This was my first time but not my sons. He and his family are regulars in CA. I ordered the strawberry lemonade and calamari for the appetizer. The calamari was average, but heck, who can&#39;t make calamari? I didn&#39;t really see anything on the menu that stood out to me that I really wanted. Honestly everything on the menu is what you&#39;ll find on the menu at Denny&#39;s. I looked at the Lasagna but it was &#34;vegan,&#34; that killed that for me! I ended up with the small rectangular pizza on a board. Not that great. My son had a cheese stuffed burger that literally exploded all over his arm when he took his first bite. That was mess. I personally don&#39;t see me eating at another Cheesecake Factory. What&#39;s all the hype about!?! PS. Waiter was cool. That was the best part!

Cheesecakes food and service is always great... but i do have to commend the manager Don. Their was a mixup on our reservation mind you on our end. Don being as amazing as she is took care of us and was so kind to accomodate our party without hesitation. For this being a super busy location on the strip ( with over a hour+ wait) they really do care about the exprience  of every single person dinning in. Out of all cheesecakes by far this is the best. As well Thank You  T ( our server) you where so amazing.

Food was great but servers were rude....<br><br>When we sat down and I wanted to ask a server for napkins. So I asked a random server for napkins and she said &#34;sorry I&#39;m not your server&#34; in a rude way and walked away. <br><br>Am I wrong? Idk

The walls are adorned with warm oranges, reds and golds which seem very inviting. The light is dimmed to calm the mind and there seems to be a slight buzz of anticipation as if something is going to happen but never does.<br>I ordered the egg and chorizo breakfast burrito and was pleasantly surprised with the size of the burrito and the sides that came with it. Every dish had its own unique taste that complimented the meal in its entirety. I&#39;ve never had black beans but I was surprised by the pleasant and distinct taste.<br>I&#39;m over six foot tall and 260 pounds and I couldn&#39;t finish this burrito. The burrito itself had a good flavor and consisted of many different textures and tastes that made the dish a fan favorite for me.

The Cheesecake Factory is a chain and acts just like one. You are in Las Vegas. Have some great food, have some cheap food, have a hot dog. Don&#39;t go here.<br>It is packed. The lines are long. It is loud. The menu is huge, which is nice, but really, don&#39;t bother.<br>The service is fair, the food is fine, the prices too high for what you get and you get more than you need. <br>There are so many places to eat that you may not have a chance to dine at again. Go to one of those. The CheeseCake Factory is boring and not worth your time.
We got seated right away and our waiter was the best! Very attentive and helped me find the drink i was looking for. The customer service was a 5

This is a busy location in Caesars Palace, but a couple of us only wanted a slice of cheesecake to go. The to go area is busy also but moves fast. We had our orders in less than ten minutes. So we wouldn&#39;t have to walk through the entire Forum, a couple of us idled in the car on the lower level of Caesars nearest the restaurant while the others went in for the cheesecake.

Excellent food, decent service. My cousin visiting from out of state loves cheese cake factory so for her birthday we visited the Caesars location since Caesars is known for their excellent service. Unfortunately our server Alicia forgot to pack up our food to go. We waited 30 minutes after she said she would take care of it, couldnt catch her attention, and decided to just forget it and leave. Despite all of this we still left a good tip hoping it was just an honest mistake as we are experienced with the food hospitality industry. We only wish the food we paid for went home with us to finish.
Waited an hour for Steak Diane only to find out, they ran out of mashed potatoes during dinner hour. Worst experience at this location ever.
All of the utensils were dirty and the server took awhile to greet us and ask for our drink order. However, the food was good.

I love The Cheesecake Factory and this one is no exception. The menu features a large variety of food. If you like sushi, you&#39;re going to want the Ahi Tartare! And if you are in the market for a cocktail of sorts, I highly recommend the Peach Bellini. This Cheesecake Factory is located at the far end of the Forum Shoppes at Caesars. It is busy but I particularly liked that there was &#34;outdoor/patio&#34; seating even though it&#39;s still indoors. While we were having dinner on the &#34;patio&#34; we also got to see the Atlantis show. In summation, I highly recommend. The walk through the Forum Shoppes to get to The Cheesecake Factory is very nice as well.

I&#39;ve always had a great experience with the Cheesecake Factory back home. So I thought this would be a great place to eat when we were grabbing dinner in Caesar&#39;s Palace. Wait was 40 minutes so we went next store to the awesome gift shop. After we were sat we ordered waters and a beer for me and a cocktail for my friend. The prices are not on the menu. We ordered our meals. Bang bang chicken and pasta de Vinci. We also ordered each a side salad. The bang bang chicken wasn&#39;t at all what I expected. Tasted like ramen. Couldn&#39;t get it out of my head. Lol guess I shouldn&#39;t have experimented with something new I&#39;ve never gotten. <br><br>My friend got the pasta which tasted like butter pasta. They forgot the Madeira sauce or something because it had no flavor at all! I&#39;ve had it before and it was seriously missing something.... we didn&#39;t tell our server because we just figured maybe that&#39;s how it should&#39;ve been... idk we were very confused. Ended up throwing it out when we got home. <br><br>My beer was a blue moon. Couldn&#39;t drink it. It was super yeasty and tasted like the end of the keg. Also the cosmopolitan my friend got was yummy. But was 14$. In the end our meal was over priced for the poor taste of our food. Definitely won&#39;t be getting these menu items again. Also I&#39;ll never ever buy alcohol from cheesecake again....

This place is inside Cesar&#39;s Palace which is cool it has a large salt water fish tank just outside with a show every hour. <br><br>The restaurant is usually crowded. We didn&#39;t have much room at our table. We had a group of five.<br><br>The food is good as always. With a few exceptions.<br>I had the shrimp and chicken gumbo which is delicious and my go to favorite. The shrimp was way over cooked and rubbery unfortunately, but came in a really great portion size. Also the bread was a little overdone/crispy.<br><br>My wives steak tacos were delicious but they came after everyone was already done eating. Like 15-20 minutes after everyone else&#39;s food came out. They did give her a free cheesecake for the trouble though...<br><br>The waiters were really apologetic and accommodating though.<br><br>So this place is average compared to other Cheesecake Factories but it&#39;s cool to go see the show outside if you plan on it beforehand!

The host was very friendly, our waiter (forgot his name) I think ty was awesome! Our food delicious!! So While we where waiting to be seated which was very fast we saw the mango lime cake so we didn&#39;t think anything about it and decided to try it out, well not knowing it had coconut we freaked out cuz we have a child with allergies (epi pen needed) so it was a bit scary! <br>But she is as fine she spit it out right way!! <br>So I guess for families with food allergies it would be good to know ahead of the time!

When in Rome do as the Roman&#39;s do. A popular thing to do in this Roman themed mall is to visit the Cheesecake Factory. At the Forum Shops, all roads lead to the Cheesecake Factory located where the main corridor concludes at the Journey to Atlantis Show. <br><br>   It seems that the time I initially started visiting this Cheesecake Factory is older than the statues and columns that border this Roman themed mall. In a sense this is partially true considering that my visits go back long ago prior to the Forum Shops expansion when Virgin Records was the cool place to visit during the George W. Bush administration. Today, at the end of the Obama administration, the food and dining experience here is just as good as when George W. Bush was in office. <br><br>   This Cheesecake Factory is usually busy. There is quite a difference waiting here than an uninteresting  place such as the DMV. Here, patrons wait in an area with the sounds and sights of Rome. Where else can you wait for dinner while watching statues above a 50,000 gallon aquarium come to life to battle it out in the &#34;Fall of Atlantis&#34;? Waiting gets even better with the signature cheesecake displays at the other side of the hostess. Waiting would be even better if there was no waiting. The Cheesecake Factory has yet to offer the texting or beeper system.<br><br>    The Cheesecake Factory is a spacious and attractive restaurant that includes tables overlooking the &#34;Fall of Atlantis&#34; show. The tables deep inside the restaurant are envoloped in an elegant interior. On the majority of my visits including the latest, we sat deep in the restaurant. <br><br>   The Cheesecake menu is to restaurants what the nearby 50,000 gallon aquarium is to aquariums: Giantic! As soon as I saw eggplant parmesan with pesto pasta, on this visit I instantaneously bypassed around 250 other choices. Eggplant parmesan is one of my favorite dishes. I was so :-) to see it on the menu. With that said, in the past I have enjoyed commendable sandwiches including the eggplant parmesan sandwich, burgers, and a BLT. The eggplant parmesan with pesto pasta is reasonably priced at $14.95. Unlike some restaurants on the Las Vegas Strip, this is not a tourist trap. With the entree, I ordered bottomless Coke. Ahead of the dinner, the attentive waiter served us bread with butter.<br><br>  The eggplant parmesan was delicious with a capital D. The Cheesecake Factory style of serving eggplant parmesan is separate round pieces bordering pesto pasta. Every bite of the eggplant parmesan covered with mozzarella cheese, fontina cheese, and marina cheese made me feel like a Roman emperor. Likewise I relished the taste of the pesto pasta. This is the first time that a restaurant served eggplant parmesan with pesto pasta. Cheesecake Factory had broke the tradition of serving eggplant parmesan with pasta under marinara sauce. Regardless, I truly enjoyed it. The dinner was so enjoyable that time went fast, and before you knew it we were leaving Rome for the Las Vegas Strip. It&#39;s just a shame that I never leave enough room for the cheesecake.<br><br>   I have been a fan of this Cheesecake Factory going back years prior to holding a smartphone when Virgin Records was the attraction. This dining environment inside a faux Ancient Rome overlooking a 50,000 gallon aquarium where statues come to life to battle it out in the &#34;Fall of Atlantis&#34; show is exclusive. The generous menu offers several choices from the cheeseburger to eggplant parmesan. The prices are reasonable. And the service has always been solid. In conclusion, Julius Caesar would be proud of the Forum Shops Cheesecake Factory.
They have the best cheeseburger , with cheese stuffed inside. Friendly staff and very clean.

Huge menu. We came here around 11 am on a Saturday and it was only a short 2-3 minute wait. I got a blended peach drink with a raspberry swirl (I can&#39;t remember the name) which was delicious. The bread was good- white and honey oat I believe. They were hard, but I think maybe that&#39;s how they&#39;re supposed to be? <br><br>I ordered chicken fettuccine Alfredo and it was really good. I ordered the supper portion instead of the lunch portion- huge mistake. It was SO much pasta; I don&#39;t know if I even ate half of it. <br><br>My mom got an omelette with breakfast potatoes that she said was good. I tried the potatoes and they were nice and crispy. My dad ordered the everything pizza and it looked so good (he said it was good and filling). I&#39;m for real considering going back before we leave Vegas just so I can order and try the pizza.

5 stars for all other locations, especially for the food and cheesecake (duh).  But if you go this location which is at Caesars...I would not sit out front, it&#39;s not pleasurable due to the lighting, noise, and people.  The service was slow due to being busy but that&#39;s management, our server did great for having so many tables.  Wait for a table inside.

LOVE cheesecake factory and this location in particular the staff is incredibly friendly and they really space out tables due to COVID so its a nice and even on the quieter side of dining. Our waitress was super nice and we never had to ask for refill or anything she was VERY attentive. The food is very good i ordered the tomato basil pizza with side salad (DELICIOUS) and my boyfriend ordered a fresh salad sandwich and those crispy hot pocket buffalo wings and let me tell you...... he took one bite and i swear i saw his eyes roll in the back of his head it was so good he practically inhaled the rest. Finished with some strawberry shortcake and ice cream and was not disappointed. The shortcake was made in house and absolutely delicious and had the perfect amount of crumble. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting Vegas and want a tasty meal for a reasonable price. Will be coming here again!!!!

I am a huge Cheesecake Factory lover, I really wanted to eat here before we left Vegas. My husband and I along with our friends went for dinner.  It&#39;s super busy, so the wait was about an hour or more. But they have cool attractions and stores close by. The fish tanks out front is very appealing. My daughter enjoyed walking around looking at the fishes.Cheesecake Factory&#39;s location within Caesars Palace is a prime locations because there is just so much to see. Caesars Palace had a greek god show (not sure if they have it all the time) but the show was cool. We got to watch it as we ate.  <br>The service wasn&#39;t that great because they were super busy. The food took awhile to come out. When it did come out, some of it was cold. I guess they wanted to wait for everything to be ready before they brought it out. But it was just too busy for us to ask them to heat up our food, considering we waited an hour to order and about 40 mins for our food to come out. Needless to say we still enjoyed our food. We are big Cheesecake Factory lovers. And the greek gods show definitely helped to keep us entertained. <br>I would recommend Cheesecake Factory. Just remember if you choose to eat here, be prepared to wait.

Normally the service is at least four stars but being the afternoon of New Years Eve maybe they were short of cooks. Our order was taken quickly. She asked if we wanted bread and we said no. She came back with bread and said they only had wheat. Good thing because it was almost an hour later before we got our food. I ordered a small Caesar salad with no croutons...but it came with croutons. She offered to take it back but I didn&#39;t want to wait any longer. Quicker to just pick them out. We ordered lettuce chicken tacos and edamame. We were wondering why these items took so long to be served. We ended up asking for our cheesecakes to go to save time. Nothing wrong with our food but was kind of full because of munching on bread while waiting a long time. Carrot and low carb Cheesecake were delicious as expected.
It took a while to be seated and also to be served. I got the Chipotle Chicken Pasta and it was delicious. I got the lunch portion, but it was still very filling.

I spent Memorial weekend in Las Vegas. I had a great time people watching and outlet mall shopping. One evening before I noticed it was quite late and I needed to eat. I chose Cheesecake Factory because the food was familiar and reasonably priced. The service staff was friendly and attentive despite the late hour. <br><br>The most interesting part of the evening were the people around me like the loud, obnoxious men who kept shouting &#34;It&#39;s Trump&#39;s America&#34; or the girl who literally took a nap in the bread basket. Love Las Vegas!

Excellent  food here. The burger I ordered  was better  than the one I had at Ramsey&#39;s burger. AND it came with fries included. I appreciate  that. Good drinks just too high priced. But all in all my new favorite  place.

Went out of my way and went to this place in the back of the mall.   My wife and I ordered dinner.  While waiting for dinner I realized I still had free coupons for a slice of Cheesecake.   They were given to me when I purchased gift cards over the holidays.    I asked the server to please ask the manager if he/she would honor the coupon as I realized it expired yesterday but due to the current pandemic and the fact they have been closed I unable to get in to use the coupon.  Server came back to my table and said manager will not honor it and that&#39;s that.   She told me I had plenty of time to come in to redeem it. I felt the manager should of come to my table and tell me &#34;no&#34; and some explanation as to why it couldn&#39;t be honored.   It&#39;s not like they don&#39;t have plenty of Cheesecake laying around.     How about come to my table and say I am sorry corporate won&#39;t let me honor it but how about I comp your $4 soda. After eating our meal the server had the nerve to ask me &#34;Did you leave any room for desert&#34;.     At that point I just wanted the hell out of there.    I have been to Cheesecake probably 50 times.   From Las Vegas , Irvine to San Francisco.      Never again.  So many places to enjoy a meal no need to go to a place where the manager can&#39;t even come to your table and discuss.   You said &#34;No&#34; and now myself and friends say &#34;No&#34; to you.     By the way while you were spending your last few months at the pool soaking up the rays.    I&#39;ve been in the hospital taking care of your family and friends.    Peace

This is a wonder vegan cob salad! They have only a few vegan options but they are great portion sizes. This makes it easy for traveling groups with vegans and non vegans. We sat outside and got to enjoy the wonderful view. The waitress was very helpful. Thankful we found some vegan options in the mall area and didn&#39;t have to go far. No vegan cheese cake yet which is a bummer! I hope they make one ASAP! I have a great recipe if they need one!
Food was great! Nice environment, kind of dark though but that&#39;s just Cheesecake Factory. Our waiter was nice and we didn&#39;t have to ask for water or bread etc. would come back again.

Veggie Burger is misrepresented, 4 times try and the kitchen still couldn&#39;t produce the warm toasted brioche and burger warm, it was straight up cold, while the cheese was melted and warm, strange experience.

Great experience because no one argued with me here at Cheesecake! Shoutout to the Drake fans who get the reference.<br><br>Huge portions here and great for family sharing type of dinner. The prices reflect the huge portions and decent quality. <br><br>Service was quick and they were really friendly and helpful in helping me make my order. I opted for the fettuccini Alfredo which is always a classic.

It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s a chain. It&#39;s over-priced. But it sure is tasty. And there are so many food, drink, and dessert options. I can dine forever on just appetizers here.<br><br>This particular location is nestled in the Caesar&#39;s Forum Shops. It&#39;s rarely too crazy busy where there&#39;s a wait. I prefer dining on the faux &#34;patio&#34; so I can people watch the mall. And you can sorta see, albeit mostly hear, the free show thingy that happens at the fountain / fish tank out front of this location.<br><br>Service was decent. A bit scattered. But attentive and friendly enough.<br><br>On my visit here, they were out of buffalo blasts. Which was incredibly sad as those are the absolute most greatest thing ever at Cheesecake Factory. In fact, they are the best take on buffalo wings my taste buds have had the pleasure of enjoying.<br><br>But it wasn&#39;t a total dismal thing as there was a new (at least to me) menu item - buffalo chicken meatballs. They were just like the buffalo blasts, but in meatball form. Extremely tasty.<br><br>The mac &#39;n&#39; cheese bites were also a hit. The Cheesecake Factory really does do this trendy appetizer better than most.<br><br>All the other appetizers we sampled were tasty too, but less memorable and crave-worthy.<br><br>All in all, there are far better, more unique, Vegas-specific places to throw down your money for good eats. But when you need to please a crowd, have a specific craving, everywhere else is full, and/or you just need to get off your feet and eat right now and you&#39;re right by here... It&#39;s better than most other chains and it&#39;s got decent people watching.

This restaurant experience was not that great. First I had to wait 10 minutes to get seated. After I got seated, it was another 10 minutes before someone asked me if I wanted water or anything. <br><br>The spot they put me in was way too noisy and I asked to sit in the patio. Nice view out there, but then again another 10 minutes to get my order.<br><br>The food in my option wasn&#39;t all that great.  I will not be coming back here.

It was my first time at The Cheesecake Factory, and it was good for a first experience. The wait was a little long, which is to be expected in Las Vegas, but because of this the staff were a little rushed. Food tasted great, and the smoothie was really good. We shared a piece of original cheesecake, and it was absolutely delicious. Definitely understand why this place is famous! I would for sure recommend you try the cheesecake, at least.

This location in the Forum Shops at Caesar&#39;s Palace needs to get their act together. If you tell a party of 7 that it will take 1.5-1.75 hours you need to make sure to seat them at that time especially when you have sr. citizens in the party who need to eat. <br><br>It is understandable during a long holiday weekend that it will be long lines anywhere, but it shouldn&#39;t require manager intervention to make sure we get seated after waiting for 2 hours.<br><br>I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory all over California as well as Summerlin ... I expected more from this location. Terribly disappointed.

Always enjoy Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>This location is tucked in a corner of Caesars palace forum of shops. <br><br>Great extensive menu, portions, lively ambience and great pricing. Love lunch menu portions which are still too large but great value. <br><br>Service always top notch and friendly.<br><br>Desserts are what makes this place too. Any cheesecake is delicious. <br><br>Definitely worth the stop.

This location is located in the Caesars Palace shopping center in Las Vegas. It is a very busy location but we were pleasantly surprised by how fast and efficient we were seated and served immediately. Our server as well as the host were so polite and genuinely friendly that it made this experience an amazing time for me and my family. There is a wide selection of food options and I am so happy to see that the cheesecake factory is starting to offer some healthier alternatives. <br><br>The service here is very fast and the ambience and the decor is beautiful. It can be a little dimly lit and somewhat noisy if you were sitting next to the kitchen but the fact that the service was so quick and professional made up for this. Our food was freshly prepared and served pretty quickly in my opinion. The server was so kind to always update us on the status of our food and when things were taking a little bit longer than they should have. He was very polite and kind and his customer service was outstanding. Everything about this particular location is five star&#39;s in quality service and professionalism. Whenever we visit Vegas and are in the mood for the cheesecake factory we will come back to this location with no hesitation. Excellent service overall with high-quality standards and super delicious food and desserts. Highly, highly recommend it for anybody visiting Las Vegas.

We went to have dinner here this past weekend and it seemed as though all of the workers (from hostess to the manager) had an attitude. We got seated at a table where there was food thrown about all over the floor and no one bothered to clean it up. To top it off, our utensils that were supposedly clean and wrapped in a cloth napkin were still caked in food when we unwrapped them. If the utensils aren&#39;t clean, then I can only imagine what else isn&#39;t here. I&#39;ve never had a bad experience at a Cheesecake Factory before until this night. We cancelled our meal right away and left.

Let&#39;s start with the good: the service was great. One individual, who was not our waiter, brought us a bread and banana shaped in a butterfly plate for free for our two kids. This guy deserves a raise or at least a bonus for his thoughtfulness and recognition for going above and beyond. Please recognize this individual. I wish I would&#39;ve got his name, but he was working Friday evening the 16th of Nov around 4:45 PM. Our server was great as well.<br><br>Now, to the bad. First, I&#39;m disappointed in the quality and overall price of the kids menus and food. We got them the macaroni and cheese, and one grilled chicken. The macaroni was very basic and had little cheese on it. My kids usually gobble down macaroni and cheese, but they didn&#39;t like this one at all. After tasting it myself, I was extremely disappointed. The chicken was super dry without any flavor. Moving onto our entrees, my salads had lettuce and tomatoes that were borderline unacceptable. The freshness definitely was not there. My wife&#39;s entree was good. <br><br>I wouldn&#39;t mind so much for the children&#39;s meals if the cost wasn&#39;t so high. But I can get extremely better quality kids meals at half the price at lesser quality restaurants.<br><br>As always, the cheesecake was amazing, and what we will continue to go back for.

From the start their was a 30 minute wait but they didn&#39;t have any more buzzers so they told me to return in 25 mins.. so we walked around the near by art gallery and returned for buzzers then they finally had me stand by with my buzzer for 30 mins. The food was great.

Great food and service. I was pleasantly surprised as I thought as a chain restaurant it may be a little naf but no it was fantastic. I had the carne asada steak, it was amazing, cooked MR as requested and full of flavour.

I have been to this location a number of times, and have left satisfied every time. They have two floors and a seating area out in the front to enjoy the hourly show and huge fish tank (and people watching... who am I kidding). All of my waiters &amp; waitresses have done a great job and making sure my needs were met :) The ambiance is like every other Cheesecake Factory; dim and romantic.<br><br>My most recent time here I ordered the Renee Special. It is half of a sandwich, a bowl of soup, and a small side salad. All of it was great! The only thing is the salad was a little bland and only had leaves and balsamic vinaigrette. The soup was incredible! Cream of chicken with bacon bits on top. The half of sandwich was really good as well.<br><br>I would recommend Cheesecake Factory for anyone, the menu is extensive enough to meet anyone&#39;s craving needs!

The food was delicious like always....... but the customer service that we got from our servers at Cheesecake Factory located at the forum shop at Ceasars Palace staff was just simply amazing! A big smile takes you a long way! We were there Sunday night at 7:30 pm ...... from the hostess, the busboy/busman to our SERVER . Thank you so much

Calamari, water, lemonade, Miso and Herb Grilled salmon was ordered.<br><br>Wait time was roughly 30 minutes.<br><br>Miso over white rice. Entire dish was lukewarm and that&#39;s being generous. Sauce was gritty like it wasn&#39;t mixed properly. Rice was not only over cooked &amp; mushy but old stale and crusty like it was scraped out.<br><br>Herb Grilled salmon was properly made. No comment.<br><br>Water was the best thing they served.<br>Lemonade was the fake kind that you get from a powder. Actually disgusting.<br><br>Calamari wasn&#39;t bad. <br><br>Service was nonexistent. Came by for drinks. Asked us how we were doing. Other servers brought us our food.

I work in the Forum Shops so I eat here more often than most. I&#39;ve ordered items like the Factory Burger($12.95)that were to DIE for and some items like the Cuban sandwich($13.95) that were terribly disgusting. Nonetheless, I keep coming back for more. <br><br>The portions here could feed 3 people, no joke. The prices are high because of the enormously insane portion sizes. (Not as big as Hash House A Go-Go but still huge) <br><br>My favorite item thus far: the Eggplant Parmesan!!! ($15.50)The flavor is fantastic. The marinara sauce and fontina cheese that&#39;s layered  on the crisp eggplant &#34;lasagna style&#34; is wonderful. It&#39;s not too salty which is a plus. The pesto pasta doesn&#39;t overpower the dish itself either. <br><br>Eva, the cashier at the bakery counter is such a sweetheart! She&#39;s always super helpful with special requests and additional sauces if needed. AND she&#39;s always smiling! <br><br>Overall, you CAN go wrong at this place but with my help....that won&#39;t happen!!

So good! I ordered the chicken salad sandwich and it came out perfect. You could taste all the flavors and it wasn&#39;t too big either. Service was pretty good, a bit slow but it was quite packed. Very happy with this visit to the Cheesecake Factory. Thank you!

My wife ,son and I had a nice dinner .after an initial wait due to the amount of people eating here which usually means it will be worth the wait <br><br>And it didn&#39;t disappoint , the menu was full of choices and the portion size was on the large size for us BUT it tasted great , the service was attentive but not over bearing and when it came to the cheese cake wow and there was a 30th Anniversary cheese cake to funny because it are 30th Anniversary is why we here this trip so we had to have one of them to .m, supersized portions that tasted delicious, we see a lot of people taking there&#39;s home as the couldn&#39;t manage anymore food <br><br>Worth a visit not too badly priced

First we were following the GPS and could not find the restaurant because it is actually in Caesars Palace at the forum shops. It was very busy but we didn&#39;t have to wait too long for a table, about 10 minutes.<br><br>I ordered the firecracker salmon rolls as my meal, it was good but I thought the salmon was a little underdone. My husband ordered the Hibachi Steak which he loved. He had a lemonade and I had a strawberry lemonade they were both really sweet but our server gave us  water which I added to mine to cut the sweetness.<br><br>Our server was wonderful, the staff was very pleasant and the atmosphere was really nice.

Ice tea so sour I could not drink it. I frequent cheesecakes and this is one of the worse ones. Staff hot or miss, some great some not at all. The food is not good. To over cooked the ice tea cane warm and was very sour.

Cheesecake Factory truly is one of my favourite restaurants -- Service is always tops and the portions are HUGE! <br><br>Dined in on the 21st of December for my baby sisters birthday and this location had the perfect vibe, music and staff. Our server Jeff was a delight so definitely ask for him when you&#39;re there!<br><br>Their Avocado Egg Rolls served with a Tamarind-Cashew dipping sauce is to die for! If you haven&#39;t had it yet and want a savoury appetiser, it&#39;s the best choice. Egg Rolls were fresh, crunchy and the sauce is delicious; If they bottled it and sell it, I&#39;d definitely buy. <br><br>For my entrée, I had the yummy Evelyn&#39;s Favourite Pasta; rigatoni tossed with so many veggies and topped with a pesto. <br><br>I also got the Vegan Cobb Salad, which by the way is HUGE, so I definitely recommend sharing it! <br><br>Last but not least, my favourite part... the Cheesecake. You can&#39;t go to Cheesecake Factory and not get Cheesecake, that&#39;s just wrong. So I had a slice of the Celebration Cheesecake and Fresh Strawberry Cheesecake to go.
Excellent Diana Steak !<br>The steak is very juicy !  I love it <br>The price is so reasonable !!<br>I recommend it to everyone...

It&#39;s been a while since we have been to the Cheesecake Factory. I think the quality has gone down over the years or maybe my taste has improved. <br><br>We stopped in for a bite while shopping.   We got a salad which was gigantic.  The waitress was great. Very helpful. My wife always wants something changed and the waitress was more than happy to accommodate.  Nothing we asked for. Was unreasonable. The only bad thing about the salad was the quality of the tomatoes in the salad.  <br><br>I do not think they were cut fresh. I suspect they are food pack pre diced tomatoes because they were so bland and mushy. <br><br>The four stars reflects the service we got. The food was more of a 2.5<br><br>We will definitely be back. Next time substituting the tomatoes for something else.

Great dinner, great service. We stopped by the Cheesecake Factory after passing it a few times. (always busy)   We sat down and was served very quickly. It was a bit dark, so we used our phones for the light on our menu&#39;s. Others were using their phones, so it wasn&#39;t just us. The food was excellent. We had the Chicken Piccata, and one of the other chicken dishes. They were both excellent. The Chicken in both dishes was good. Thin and cooked perfectly, and the seasons on each piece of chicken was great. We ended with a big piece of Cheese Cake. The dinner was good. The best thing about the Cheesecake Factory is that its consistent and the food is always good. It&#39;s a simple go-to place for me. (when in doubt)

To start I love The Cheesecake Factory and am always pleased. Today was a lot different. I&#39;m going back to get names tomorrow. Not a busy day , but food took more than 60 minutes to get to us. We think the waitress just didn&#39;t put our order in. (On accident)  the people that came  after us by 30 minutes got served first . We asked for a manager and a lady came and argued with us. Was saying that we came into the restaurant after the time we said we came. We didn&#39;t raise our voices, I did say &#34;this shit is ridiculous &#34; in regards to her arguing with us. She offered us free dessert. And we asked for another manager . Just then my GF says to our friend &#34;she offered us dessert &#34; and as the lady was walking away she turned around and said &#34;what did you say?&#34;  In a mean way being confrontational. We couldn&#39;t believe . Then another manager came and he was super nice and comped all the meals. Finally, we ordered a meal to go &#34;Angel hair pasta with chicken&#34; and got to our room and there was no chicken.

I recently tackled an ambitious multi-course dinner here, which was both stomach filling and palate pleasing.  <br><br>For starters, I began with Crispy Fried Cheese, which was composed of a nice mix of both Mozzarella and Fontina Cheeses.  Following close behind were pan-fried Chicken Pot Stickers, which were satisfying doused in a Ginger &amp; Soy Dipping Sauce, and SkinnyLicious Shrimp Summer Rolls that were wrapped in Rice Paper along with asparagus and Shitake Mushrooms.  The cold, fairly wide (not particularly skinny) rolls were lip-smacking good dipped in  either a provided Chili Dip or Peanut Dip. <br><br>Next a large cup of spicy Tortilla Soup that would be labeled a &#34;bowl&#34; most everywhere else contained a pleasant but unusual concoction of rice- and corn-filled enchilada-flavored liquid.  Complimentary Brown Bread was excellent.<br><br>Although by this time more food was hardly necessary, a packed California Cheesesteak that was filled with thinly sliced grilled steak, onions, peppers, and melted cheese, and covered with sauteed mushrooms inside a toasted Ciabatta Roll, was nicely done.  Accompanying French Fries were good, and the Cole Slaw that went with Diane&#39;s Fried Shrimp Platter was cool and creamy.  Obviously there was no further room for dessert, so it was forsworn.        <br><br>Delivery was late on Diane&#39;s ordered Root Beer.  Otherwise service was very attentive.  A California casual atmosphere well suited my choice of sandwich.  <br><br>XXXX-1/2 Overall!

I gave this place another chance and they failed to satisfy me. Our server was very un attentive, we were low on drinks most of the time, the portions for the food this time were very small. <br>They didn&#39;t check on us at all<br><br>Friendly server, most of the food was good but our pepperoni flat bed did not taste right. We barely even ate it, the manager asked how was it and we told him hoping he could switch it with something else or take it off the bill but he didn&#39;t. The server didn&#39;t either i left d
Best cheesecake factory i have ever been to...  I tried 4 cheesecake factory in LA，but none of them can compare with the one in LVegas...

Currently sitting here at the Cheesecake Factory at the Forum Shoppes in Las Vegas. Our calamari appetizer arrived cold, when I informed the waiter he cordially apologized and took the dish back to the kitchen. He returned with a what we thought was a fresh order only to find out that all the kitchen did was dump the order into the fryer. Now the calamari is scorching hot but charred, crispy and unedible. I candidly asked the waiter if the kitchen just redropped the calamari into hot oil and he admittedly said that is exactly how they reheated the dish. I kindly told him that it was unacceptable and to please remove the dish from the table.<br>Come on Cheesecake Factory.

Food great, Been there many times, over<br>15 in last 5 years. Past 2 times, were a disaster. My girlfriend finished her dinner<br>Then mine finally came, no apologies from<br>Waiter or manager. This past time arrived<br>At 615 pm wed night, told 15 min wait, waited 15 got table on time. Ordered food at 625 and was asked if we wanted bread(a main reason i go, there it is delicious) waited 25minutes  and then asked waiter where is our bread? He says they are really busy. 710 rolls around finally<br>Some bread comes 45 minutes we waited, then 10 minutes later we got our food. Almost an hour (55 mins) from ordering). It was good though.

One of favorites in Vegas! Always a go to the food and service is always on point! For an exception our last visit the wife came specifically for their Alfredo and they didn&#39;t have it at that time! Boo! My meatloaf was very  tasty!

I&#39;m a fan! The lighting was a bit to dark for me, although the food was amazing and that&#39;s why we&#39;re all here now isn&#39;t it! The wait wasn&#39;t too long. Seating was intimate and I appreciate y server placing me at a table for two and not a table for four with two empty seats. That&#39;s a plus!
