Appetizers, entree, and desserts all came out with time to enjoy each course. The price isn&#39;t as expensive as my friends have been saying. It&#39;s decent and the refills keep coming for drinks. My server was really nice and speedy! I love the atmosphere in this restaurant!! Relaxing!<br><br>Pros: Decent price, food chain, delicious food, great service, intimate setting, appealing decor<br><br>Cons: A little crowded, dark lighting, no music, no wifi, no apple pay that I could see<br><br>Overall: I&#39;ll be back very soon! Keep up the great work guys! I&#39;m satisfied and happy!
Getting our food was slow help with shitty and it took a long time to get our food The people look like you&#39;re all pissed off here working

One of my favorite restaurants.Although it be been there a few times but I can&#39;t order anything but the &#34;Da Vinci&#34; pasta, with chicken and mushroom. The bread is also a reason enough to go there with a combination of fresh homemade bread. The main attraction is the cheesecakes of course but don&#39;t let the name fool you; their menu is as good as the cheesecakes (so be easy on the bread if you want to save room for dessert!). Service is ok but seeing how busy the place always is, you can&#39;t expect fast service but they are efficient and friendly enough. My personal favorite cheesecake is the white chocolate, but I&#39;m sure you will have your own...
Huge menu and great cake ! CHEESECAKE! Celebration CHEESECAKE!Layers of Vanilla Cake, Cheesecake, Strawberry, Chocolate and Vanilla Mousse with Cream Cheese Frosting and sprinkles!!!

Ate here my first two days of vacation and on my first day the server tried to rip me off on my bill. When I told her she shorted me on my change she gave me a ride look and didn&#39;t apologize. My bill was $69.45 and when I went up to her she claimed that the bill was $70. I told her you cannot round my bill up and short me money. She finally gave me back my change difference after a good five minutes. Poor customer service. <br><br>My second day the server I had brought us our waters with no straws and when we asked him for straws he put his finger tips all over the mouth pieces and then placed them in our drinks. I then told him we wanted sealed straws and he went and came back. During these three times he was at our table, not once did he ask us if we were ready to order he would look at our table and go to his other tables and help them. Very rude. I had to tell him we were ready to order and after a couple of times of me telling him we were ready he finally began to change his tune. I&#39;ve never seen such poor service like this at the Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s a great place to eat with a delicious menu, but the servers at this location are bad.

We went to The Cheesecake Factory for a family night the server was so rude took forever to get our drinks and appitizers we were  there for nearly two hours customers around us came later and received their bread as soon as they sat down. we had to ask three times for ours. the lady next to us came in 10 minutes later received her bread appetizer her drink and food  before we even got our appetizers. He rarely checked on us we needed refills we had to ask him for a refill customers around has had their bread before we even got ours. Management was no help at all so we paid for our order and left and we would never return there again it was our first time and we will not be back
Always a good place to eat when you don&#39;t know what you want! Can&#39;t go wrong with the avocado rolls :)

Waited an hour for our food, when it arrived it was up to par. Didn&#39;t actually leave for another half hour. When I asked the waiter for the reason for the wait, he said he could offer free cheesecake, which was good. I expected to talk to the manager, but I simply got a stare from afar from who I assume was management. All in all, it was a pretty average Cheesecake Factory visit with subpar service for a Monday night.

Great food but busy service. They took a really long time to get our orders and get our checks. I ordered their popular shepherds pie and it was delicious, my friend ordered the fettuccine alfredo and it was really good as well. The star of the day was the cheesecake of course. I ordered the lemon raspberry cheesecake and i don&#39;t mean to exaggerate but it was the best cheesecake i&#39;ve ever had.

Disappointed to say the least. Waited 1.5 hours for them to put our group of 16 together and was told the wait was so they could get all the tables together. Sat in the same general area, but only 4 people per table and not even facing each other. Waiter seemed annoyed when asking for things and food came out 20-30 minutes apart so half of us finished before others even ate. Refilled drinks once. Not the best service overall. Super annoyed because we came for our dads 60th birthday and couldn&#39;t even enjoy family time :(

One of the worst experiences I have had at a restaurant. The service was very very slow it took forever to get water, bread, our order taken, and well anything. I ordered the cheeseburger egg rolls and the pear and Bleu cheese flat bread. Everything was fine until I bit into my third egg roll and found a hair sticking out of it... I wanted to throw up. The one saving grace about the whole experience was the manager was very polite and apologized tremendously for the hair in my food. He also took both items off of my bill. I will not be coming back to this Cheesecake Factory ever.

Honestly love the Cheesecake Factory, but today&#39;s service was the worst I&#39;ve ever had from a restaurant in a while. The worst part was he just blatantly ignored me knowing I was upset, no manager in sight and no one that cared. Left hungry, will go find food somewhere else, I am  a frequenter here but will step away for a bit.

We had 35 guest it was for a friends birthday and they did their best to sit everyone next to each other and we were served in a timely manner and even with that many people the food came out fast and it was delicious. <br><br>I had their chicken Alfredo and it was very yummy the chicken was tender and the pasta was cooked perfectly not over cooked not under cooked but just perfect. We were too full to have dessert but their red velvet cheesecake is pretty awesome we took come to go and had it later :)

It took a long time to get seated, party of eitght. But once we were, Victoria really took care of us. Lots of questions, some not so reasonable, that she handled like a pro.  Dinner was excellent and staged perfectly (drinks, apps, main).<br><br>And then we asked for... bacon cheesecake! <br><br>Not on menu.  Victoria made it for us and it was beautiful!  Straight cheesecake with bacon sprinkled over the top and whipped cream with bacon stuck in it!

Went for Valentine&#39;s Day and was very surprised there wasn&#39;t a long wait. I really like there food but haven&#39;t been able to find something I absolutely LOVE until tonight. The food was amazing and the staff was all so friendly and fast about everything!

This is my favorite restaurant located in The Forum Shops.  They have great service, food and prices.  <br><br>We recently came here and I got the pasta carbonara.  It was so tasty and perfectly cooked.  <br><br>I also enjoyed a really good slice of the perfectly made cheesecake.

Only came here for appetizer for snacking but it became a full late lunch! Ah I was full. The service is great and not really busy here during the time we came. We ordered:<br><br>1) Calamari was well deep fried and cooked but no real flavor by itself or with sauce.<br>2) Ahi tartare was very small and only for one person. Had a lot of avocado, more then ahi tuna and the sauce was just right with the wonton chips.<br>3) Buffalo wings were good and well deep fried with ranch.<br>4) Fried Zucchini was good and well cooked. Love their ranch as it seemed homemade.<br>5) Loaded potato tots were good and filled with bacon,cheese,potatoes,etc but you can only have so much. I could not eat too much of this as it almost made me sick.<br>6) Plain cheese cake with warm chocolate sauce is always my fave!<br><br>My rating is more a 3.5 stars but had to round up. I would come back but we need to watch what we order! ;-)

Ridiculously long wait for service when the restaurant was otherwise slow, and the food was barely passable.<br><br>Our waitress appeared disheveled, and she certainly wasn&#39;t very efficient. We waited more than one hour for our food, and the food is quite simple. The restaurant was also not very busy. We had a burrito, a salad, lettuce wrap tacos, and a cheese only omelette. Normally this would be served up in 25 to 35 minutes.<br><br>When the food get arrived, we pointed out to the waitress that one of the classes was horribly dirty, with a big brown ring around the inside of it. She wished it away, and laughed about it. Later, she returned again laughing, and said, don&#39;t worry about it, it was only a bad stain and not scum on the inside of the glass.<br><br>Overall, a great disappointment and we will definitely not be returning to this particular location. It was not at all up to the standards of what I have come to expect from the Cheesecake Factory, which isn&#39;t all that exciting anyway.

Opens at 11:00 a.m. We entered at 11:15. Seated immediately. Server took drink orders promptly. We waited 8-10 min just for water, tea and coffee. Ordered 2 appetizers. Then our entrees. ONE HOUR later, we had to ask where our food was. Within a few minutes it started to arrive. COLD which meant it had been sitting around. The appetizers came out LAST! They forgot my husbands beer..he never got it. By the time we got our food, we only had about 15 min. to eat before we had to leave for an engagement.The food was cold. The veggie burger was nasty. No binders so it was crumbling and sliding out of the bun. The rest of the family  not impressed  but said the food was okay. Definitely NOT worth the price we paid. Not even a I&#39;m sorry for the wait. Do yourself a favor and go to one of the other places in the Forum. Don&#39;t waste time and money here.
I have always loved this place, not just for their cheesecakes but their food is also very good.  Their menu is mostly chicken and pasta but you&#39;re sure to find something for everyone.

We stopped here for dessert. We were seated immediately. The hostess was friendly and made a couple of recommendations. The waitress came took our order and came back within minutes with our drinks. We each ordered something different. After getting our dessert orders we realize we could have spilt the massive portions.  My husband ordered a brownie and I ordered a piece of great hair silk pie. They were fresh and delicious. The were so big we couldn&#39;t eat it all. Prices were about $8.00 Each. I expected that with it being Vegas. It was a great atmosphere with great service and amazing desserts.

We had a wonderful family dinner after our race with rock n roll earlier. Bret was our waiter. Excellent. Confident and bright. . Knows his stuff. Patient with &#34;dad&#34; Jokes. Food was very good very tasty.

About 45 min wait. Cool waitress. I ordered the Carne Asada plate, it was tasty. The corn had melted cheese and good seasoning. The rice was the best it could be. I just think the menu is too big to perform a certain dish brilliantly and masterfully.

I have to start by saying that they have the best peach Bellini EVER!!<br><br>A small group of us came here and ordered the following...<br>Peach Bellini<br>Roasted beets with goat cheese salad<br>Kale and Quinoa salad<br>Crispy crab bites<br>Ahi tartare<br>Basil tomato flatbread<br><br>Everything was delicious!  The service was great.  Our server, David F. was super nice and welcoming.<br><br>I love this location.

Today I am celebrating a friend on her Birthday.    The wait was short but the service was awful.  15 minutes for a straw to the food being a soggy mess, and the house salad had black slimy lettuce.  Needless to say wont ever go back to this location again.

We had the BEST experience here! The wait staff was SUPER friendly and SOOOO attentive! The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants because of the food but this location in particular is my favorite because of the people! Shout out to Michelle (manager, I think) for being so kind to us and making sure we had a good experience (even though everything ran like clockwork from the start)!

This place was an absolute nightmare tonight. Got called up to the host stand after my buzzer went off and was told to stand behind the counter and someone would seat us shortly. My family with young children stood there for 15 minutes before I had to remind the host that I had been OBVIOUSLY standing there for an insane amount of time. Then she looks around for something and asks &#34;what pager number was yours?&#34; Then after that she takes us to our table. We get sat and order our drinks, then our food. We waited and waited and waited, ONE HOUR LATER, our entrees come out. How the hell does it take ONE HOUR to make 1 salad, 1 kids grilled cheese, 1 flatbread, and 1 Mac n Cheese Ball? How? When the server finally brought our food, I asked if the kitchen was backed up and she simply said &#34;ya&#34; and walked off. Strip restaurants typically give bad service and are over priced, and this Cheesecake Factory is no exception.

I use to be a regular at the Cheesecake Factory when the opened in Marina Del Rey.   The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make sure you were well taken care off.  <br><br>Let&#39;s move forward many yrs down the road.  The staff Doesn&#39;t seem to care and heaven forbid they check up on you. <br><br>Brian was hardly anywhere to be found and the only time I saw him was to give us our bill and pick it up.  <br><br>Our youth today doesn&#39;t know anything about customer service.

THANK YOU SO MUCH ALICIA <br>First time at this Cheesecake Factory, amazing customer service. Food was hot when we got it. Kept us with  our cup full of water, she would come and check up on us often. <br>We are going home with our celebration cheese cake, thanks Alicia for the recommendation. <br>Will be coming back soon!

Where do I even start. Basically this location STOLE a $100 dollar gift card from us.<br>Came here to eat for a family members birthday on Tuesday January 9th 2018.<br>Our bill came to a total of $163.46 <br>We wanted to pay with the 100 dollar gift card and the 63 dollars with our debit card. But the next day we realized they had charged our debit card the total $163.46 AND kept our 100 dollar gift card as well!! <br>The next day we spoke to a manger by the name of Melanie who told us she would mail a new gift card. A WEEK later we went back because no gift card had arrived and spoke to Joel, left our contact information and he said he would get back to us within 24 hours. <br>It is now FEBRUARY 26th and I haven&#39;t heard from anyone! We are so frustrated and aren&#39;t receiving much cooperation or empathy. So diapo<br><br>*UPDATE* I emailed customer service like I was asked to in the reply from Cheesecake Factory to my original review. It is now Wednesday MARCH 21st and I have yet to hear anything back?? This is ridiculous.

Gotta make this one in english <br><br>Last year I went to Vegas with some friends and i really needed to try their cheesecake at The cheesecake factory. I&#39;ve heard good things and i&#39;m a sucker for cakes so I really needed this. <br><br>We went in and started with some lunch -and wauv..... got the best bacon &amp; scrambled eggs and really big and delicious fat pancakes -yummi :)<br>Couldn&#39;t eat the whole thing because I also wanted the cake. I got one with mango on the top and my friend for one with lemon -they were both really delicious :)<br><br>The service was on top. Actually the service in the U.S is just better and sweeter than in DK. <br>The waitress was there smiling all the time, came to ask if we needed anything, if the food was ok, just chatting and wanted to hear a bit about our vacation and DK. <br><br>I am really going back -both to Vegas and the cheesecake factory - I&#39;ve never gotten such great cakes and there was a lot to choose from -gotta try then all :)

Came here for dinner 7-24-16 started around 4 pm. They were very busy, wait time was short like 5 minutes. Even though they were very busy the restaurant was very clean, nice clean floors. We were seated downstairs, started off with piña coladas, I got the everything pizza and my husband got chicken with asparagus and mashed potatoes. The drinks were delicious and the food was fresh, hot and delicious. Our server was Phillip E. He was very nice, always had our drinks full, just made our experience very enjoyable. We were so pleased we just had to let the manager know what a great experience we had.<br>Next trip to Las Vegas we will definitely come back.

First time ever dining at a Cheese Cake Factory! It&#39;s funny because there are two close to my residence but I go to Las Vegas to try it. It&#39;s in the the Cesar Forum shops right next to the Zeus Atlantis show. It&#39;s not a bad location and the surrounding is nice to look at!<br><br>Okay the food...wow. Their huge menu was off putting but the food I ordered silenced my apprehension. <br><br>I ordered the portabella, avocado and zucchini appetizer. I never eat fried food but I&#39;m happy I ordered it. Enjoy the finer, fattening things in life sometimes. <br><br>My main dish was the fish tacos! Hell yes! I loved it! Fish was cooked perfectly and it came with black beans and rice. I was full by the end of the meal. Please try this place out and enjoy your time in a great city.

Had a horrible experience today , we arrived there at 1pm got sat down of course we order our drinks and our appetizers aswell , which was brought to us really quick once she brought our appetizers we order our food waiting and waiting still nothing at 2:20 still haven&#39;t arrived with our food pretty disappointing we asked for a manager but some how our waitress brought our food out right away what a coincidence the manager arrived a few minutes later told us they were backed up that they had a rush but what a coincidence that tables around us got sat 20 min later than us and somehow got their food brought to their table by the time we left with no food still they were already on deserts  , overall very upset seeing all of that and not receiving our food within time .

With so many high end restaurants in Vegas, it&#39;s nice to have the option of a restaurant with good food for less than $20 a person (without cheesecake, of course).<br><br>My SO loves the herb roasted chicken ($18.50). It&#39;s very flavorful.  I generally like the goat cheese pear flatbread but last time I had it a this location is was lacking flavour, so this time I opted for the skinny-licious turkey sandwich. I believe the menu said it was oven roast turkey breast, so I expected hot but it was just cold turkey meat. The bun was delicious.<br><br>FYI - my SO is looking over my shoulder and does not agree with my 3 star rating. He says his chicken is 4 stars. He can write his own review

This place was terrible. The place the was very open, maybe 5 tales because it was breakfast time, and we asked for just waters, and coffee. We sat there for more than 25 mins. Just for waters. I would never come back here.

The worst Cheesecake Factory by far. We request a table for 5 out on the patio and the waiter promises us this after 20 mins which we wait. When the buzzer rings we go and wait to be seated by the same waiter for which she progresses to seat us inside and not at the table for which we waited for. We notify her of this issue and she says he will correct it in 5 mins. She then brings her manager to assist and the same waiter claims to have never seen us before and that she doesn&#39;t remember helping us so she looks like a good employee in front of her manager. We tried to file a complaint but conveniently for her, the office was closed today. Hope this helps for anyone looking to dine at what someone would expect to have satisfactory service. Overall terrible service even before we were seated so we figured if they won&#39;t help us prior to our meal, why trust them?

I love The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>It&#39;s a chain that you can rely on. No matter what location you go to, you the menu is huge, there will be many things, to choose from, whatever you get will be good, and the lemonade is bomb!!!<br><br>That sums it up. <br><br>Fave dishes:<br><br>#1 - Chicken Bellagio !!!!!!!! (Best dish ever)<br><br>#2 - Orange Chicken <br><br>This restaurant also has my favorite bread basket!<br><br>Nice thing about this location is that you can watch the statue show that Caesar&#39;s puts on.
Today is my Birthday and I came with my boyfriend and my son. I just wanted to say how wonderful our waitress Julia was! She went above and beyond to make our experience great! Thank you!

Being a chain restaurant I would say this place is definitely consistent with other locations I&#39;ve been to.  Large menu with tons of variety you are sure to find something that will suit your fancy. Some would say a bit overpriced, but portions are sized to match in my opinion.  My family loves the &#34;brown bread&#34; and we have found that the servers will gladly bring you a basket with just the bread of your liking.<br><br>What I liked about this location was the waiting process. When you approach the host stand if there is going to be a wait they hand you a card and tell you to come back after X minutes from the time written on the card (which is the time you first check in). This gives you time to wander and shop.  In my experience, upon your return they are able to seat you pretty much immediately. If a table comes up before the noted wait time then they will call out your name, but if you happen to not hear or you are in another shop no worry.

This Cheesecake Factory is absolute trash! I order from here whenever I&#39;m at work because this is the nearest thing to my job there aren&#39;t many places to eat in the forums on your lunch break so I&#39;ll do a pick up order and go get it once I&#39;m clocked out. My foods always closed and it&#39;s frustrating because I can&#39;t go back my break is only 30mins. I&#39;ll start bringing my lunch from home from now on.

The place is alright, I personally do not think that it is worth the wait that you have to go through to get in. <br>Most importantly, I do not think that this is a good place for cheesecake. I have tried it there, and it did not meet my expectation of a place named THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY.<br>Otherwise the staff is nice, environment is pretty good. <br>Was gonna give it a 3 Star, but I thought it would have been harsh just because I do not think their cheesecake taste that good.

The absolute worst service I have ever witnessed. Sheena made no attempt to be courteous, we had to ask every other server, busser, hostess, for even just our starter bread. She took about 30 minutes to bring even STRAWS. This is our last night in Vegas, and Sheena left us with stomachs emptier than our waters.

*3.5/5*<br><br>This is located at the end of Caesar&#39;s Forum Shops, right next to Nike/behind the fountain with the light show.<br><br>I came as part of a group of 5 on a Sunday afternoon, wait time for a table was only about 10 minutes.<br><br>They seemed to be understaffed as wait times once seated were long, and a couple errors were made (olives forgotten on pizza, request for no whip cream forgotten, etc). <br><br>I ate the avocado egg rolls app - these are made fresh at the restaurant. The egg rolls were crispy on the outside and the tamarind sauce paired well with it - tasty mix of sweet/tangy. <br><br>For dessert, I had the Cookie Dough cheesecake - super dense and delicious.  <br><br>A couple friends shared Chris&#39; Outrageous Cheesecake which was tasty but a bit too much going on for me (brownie, cake, coconut, chocolate chips, cheesecake).

The Cheesecake Factory has been around along time and so have I. The first time I ate at a Cheesecake Factory was in Marina Del Ray many years ago. I was with a group and waited 2 hours. Today things are not much better at the Boca Park location so I basically stopped going. No place is worth waiting for over 30 minuets and that&#39;s too long. I know they serve huge portions and you definitely pay for it, but who really needs so much?  Not me...I must say some of the options are quite tasty, but it&#39;s definitely not the place to go if you don&#39;t eat large portions or like me bring home a doggie bag that lasts 2 days<br>The cheese cake is excellent and sometimes you wait 30 minuets or more just to order cheesecake at the cheesecake counter. <br>Sorry, no matter how good the restaurant is, I will not wait over 15 minuets with an extra 5 minute buffer.

Whenever in Vegas , I always have to visit the Cheesecake Factory . <br>Although I am not usually a fan of chain restaurants especially when on vacation , I find The Cheesecake Factory to always satisfy my hunger. <br>The restaurant is way at the end of the Forum Shops in Caesars Palace right behind the Atlantis show which if seated on &#34;the patio&#34; gives you a great sight of the people shopping . <br>Food is very good.<br>Prices are decent.<br>Service is good . <br>I ordered : <br>The fried calamari (12.95) <br>Spaghetti w/ meatballs (15.95)<br>Steak w/ mashed potatoes &amp; vegetables (19.95) <br>Soft Drink <br>Total : $59.00 <br>Tip : $6.00 ( although the service was friendly I&#39;m not a generous tipper) <br>I will continue to visit this and other locations .

My hubby, daughter and I came here for lunch August 16, 2017. We were at Queens Center Mall doing a little shopping and decided to stop at this newly opened location for lunch. Well I must say this place is very good. We enjoyed everything we ordered. We had the loaded bake potato tots which was sooo yummy and cheesy. We also ordered the chicken pot sticker dumplings. My goodness so delicious . For our entree&#39;s my hubby had the chicken Parmesan pizza style which he loved, loved, loved. My daughter had the 4 cheese pasta with chicken. She loved it! I had my Shrimp scampi over linguini which was so amazing. Our server was very professional and attentive to our needs. We will definitely return to this location.

Every time i go to Cheesecake Factory i always get the same dish. They did a magnificent job preparing my meal. They even followed my request to the T on a to-go order. When most locations can&#39;t even get it right when i dine in. It was such a wonderful experience. The food was prepared in a timely manner. And it tasted simply amazing. Thank you Cheesecake Factory for always making my tastebuds dance
Great service. This has become one of my all time favorite dishes. Cheesecake Las Vegas you did not disappoint!

Hubby had a gift card for this place, so we came back here to eat during our visit to Vegas.<br>Our server, David F was very nice. I&#39;ve seen him before from our visits to this restaurant and he told us he&#39;s worked there about 12 yrs.  <br>We had:<br>1. fried calamari, $11.95. Not as good as I remembered. Wouldn&#39;t order again<br>2. Orange chicken, $16.95. Didn&#39;t taste that good. Hubby ordered it and said the orange chicken was better at Panda Express.<br>3. Skinny Caesar Salad, $9.95. I seemed to remember it was better before. No anchovies.<br>4. Coffee $3<br>5. Fresh Strawberry cheesecake, $7.95.  It was Ok. <br>I hope we don&#39;t get anymore gift cards for this place. I think the food has gone downhill.
This location is always great and has excellent customer service. One of my favorite restaurants because they have such a huge menu selection and yummy cheesecake!

Stopped here after a long walk through the forum shops. No waiting time on a Friday night. The shrimp scampi that I ordered is delicious. Shrimps are cooked and fried to the par and angel hair pasta is as usual tasty. Best part of the dish is the sauce made with lemon, sautéed garlic cloves, fresh basil, tomato, and white wine. Enjoyed the meal.
Got my bbq chicken salad like usual but no avacado due to supply issue and missing onion strings. The salad is not the same anymore.

Excellent ambiance <br>Employees friendly<br>Food is good<br>Cheesecakes are wonderful <br><br>I would definitely come back here<br><br>Hamburger was good<br>The salad had too much vinegar <br><br>Another hamburger was good<br>Sweet potato fries according to my mother in law were great<br><br>I had the clam chowder and it was excellent <br><br>The artichoke dip was okay<br>It had a little too many onions

What can I say about Cheesecake Factory... We have been to this location a few times over the years. Sometimes they are very busy and there is a wait. <br>I enjoy sitting out front and just watching the fish in the HUGE aquarium it is amazing and fun to pass the time while you wait.<br>We have never had a bad experience, the food is always very good, Portions are good.<br>This is one of those places if your in Caesars Palace you just want to eat at because you know the food is good.<br>I hate trying new places and getting ripped off! Here you never feel like your ripped off. You may go home with some of your food if you aren&#39;t real hungry.<br>Over all we Highly recommend this place, you can not go wrong eating here!!

Excellent and delicious skinny chicken pot pie! The fresh strawberry cheesecake is also to die for, pun intended! Will is fantastic waiter too, very hospitable and friendly! His service was above satisfactory and exceptional! Cheesecake Factory never disappoints! Thank you for a wonderful meal and experience! GO GCU LOPES!!!! God bless! :-)
Over priced, poor customer service and slow service. With all the options in Vegas this is not worth a stop. Don&#39;t waste your time or money

Next to free Atlantis show in Caesars Palace - we were told that we could see the show from our table &#34;outside&#34; the main Cheesecake factory, BUT it did NOT show on the video monitors as we were told - it was on the other side of the Atlantis &#34;aquarium&#34; so we could only hear the noise and see some flames coming out of the display - this would have been disappointing for children but it was no big deal to us 3 adult women.<br><br>The food was delicious as usual for a Cheesecake factory.  Our server seemed to be having a bad day and she was tired, but I guess she did her best.

I absolutely love this restaurant and try to eat there every time I am in Las Vegas. They have a menu full of variety and options and very unique combinations of food. My server was excellent and the food was delicious I have no complaints

Was seated right away.  Service was good.  Iced tea and bread with butter were good.  Avocado egg rolls were delicious.  I liked the Chicken Madeira but my daughter didn&#39;t care much for it.  Was not able to stay for dessert.

The cheesecake factory was delicious. I expected it to be really expensive but it was one of the least expensive meals we had in Vegas. The only downfall for me was that you couldn&#39;t reserve a table and had to queue and stand around waiting for one.<br><br>I had the bacon bacon cheeseburger followed by a raspberry and white chocolate cheesecake. I could barely move after. The food was amazing. Don&#39;t make plans that you have to rush off to after! You&#39;ll be way too full up lol. Very tasty food here. You have to visit!

Being located inside the Caesar palace expect to have a wait when you come to this location. Today around lunch time though we got seated quickly. The food here is okay. They have a large selection of food, too much to choose from. Having so many options can get dangerous haha. I ordered the miso salmon from the lunch menu. It was a good portion, just enough to get me full and leave room for dessert.<br><br>Just like the food menu there is a large selection of cheesecake and other desserts here. Today we ordered the strawberry shortcake and the new salted caramel cheesecake. Strawberry shortcake was really good but the cheesecake was a little too sweet for my tasting. I would come back here.

We went last Friday the 14th of July,  another Cheesecake Factory,  another bad experience.  To start off with the Hostess was rude, and instead of waiting an hour,  we waited 1 hour 45 minutes to be seated. So we get upstairs, we have to wait another 5 min to be seated. We sit down and it takes the unhappy, uncaring, feminine waiter, about 10 minutes to acknowledge us, and another 10 minutes to bring our drinks, no alcohol, just water and soda. I was looking at the other waiter and he was fast with his customers.  We order our food...<br><br>45 minutes later they bring everyone their food,  15 minutes later they bring my chicken wings and cold fries.  During the long wait,  I filled up on delicious bread, that was the only good thing.   My aunt and uncle had cold, hard, white rice with their meal. The manager said he would give us all free cheesecake for our bad experience, wrong! Only 2 of us got it,  and my cheesecake tasted dry, and the whip cream on top was hard! <br><br>Never again, Austin and Las Vegas Cheesecake Factory just isn&#39;t good!

We all had huge burgers ! I had the mushroom Swiss burger with grilled bun! Perfectly cooked medium well! <br>I ordered salad with balsamic vinaigrette instead of fries. Salad was very good &amp; large portion. 2 kinds of bread with butter served before meal. Wheat is soft &amp; warm &amp; is the best. Great service &amp; meal on a Saturday with no wait for a table! Everyone loved their meal!
This location is poor compared to their NASHVILLE locations.  Out of items on menu at 2pm in the afternoon.  Very unorganized with regard to seating people.  Seems somewhat poorly managed.

I went here last week for dinner. There were a lot of people ahead of us but we were seated within 5 minutes.<br><br>The restaurant is very clean and spacious. It has 2 dining floors and an outside portion where you can watch the animatronix  show,  the show is very loud so if you prefer quietness, stay inside. It also g wet s very dark outside, as they turn off the lights for the show.<br><br>The decor of the place is very classy. High ceilings with hanging fixtures. The place is very dim inside so it does have a classy - romantic feel to it. <br><br>The menu features a full course dining option from appetizers  to desserts. <br><br>They serve a complimentary french and honey oat bread with butter. It&#39;s very delicious and filling so thread carefully!<br>I got the avocado chicken club and it was delicious. It was served with fries that was also good as well. The club could use less tomatoes but that&#39;s juston preference!<br><br>I will definitely come back here again!

Zero star. Terrible service! <br>  I left my bag there after I finish my meal, when I back home I realize my bag is in the restaurant, and I go back immediately, but the waiter tell me there was nothing on my table.<br>  I go home again and still can not find my bag and I decide to call them back, but the lady who pick up the phone let me waiting on phone for 1 hour and then hang up my phone call. <br>  I call them back again, they said they have my bag, and I drive all the way back again. <br> When the second time I go back, I ask for their manager, and I tell him I need to drive one hour to come here each time, and I spend two hours on driving and waiting on phone for one hour just for take my bag back.  And then the manager said: you house is far away from here is not our fault, and you wait on phone for one hour is system&#39;s fault, not us. And he keep saying we are big company, we not going to steal your bag. But all I want is a apologize ok? They treat me so mean, and I have the picture for that one hour phone call.

I have been to many Cheesecake Factories all over the country and this particular location seems to always hit the mark in the food department. I usually order either steak with mash potatoes or a pasta and they always come out good!<br><br>The only two things that I have a gripe about are the wait times and that annoying creepy dragon that comes out of the aquarium every 20 min and shoots out flames. They really need to remove that because it&#39;s ear piercingly loud and gets annoying after the first time you hear it.

So I thought this would be a perfect place to grab lunch and OMG wish we would have just grabbed some Pupusas... what a disappointment!<br><br>Our waiter was like a walking zombie-idiot with no service skills whatsover.  He never even introduced himself-I thought he was the busboy and they were shortstaffed.  Just worthless! <br><br>Our table was a booth and they stuck a chair at the end of it and it was located next to the silverwear, so every waiter/busboy who came by every 15 seconds to rattle silverwear...ugh...noisy and bothersome!  We should have left.<br><br>I ordered a boring plain chopped salad that was tasteless.  Kids had grilled cheese and pasta, so thank goodness I was able to take bites out of their decent food.  Sisters got..I don&#39;t even remember because I couldn&#39;t wait to get out of there and we even skipped dessert because the waiter was so useless!<br><br>It will be a while before I go back!

I would give this 0 if I could, not just for the food error, but for the extremely poor way that they handled it.<br>I went there after Elton John on 2/21/18 . I had told my friend what a great place this was.   My companion ordered a BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger and asked for the sauce to be on the side. BBQ sauce can be sweet, smoky, vinegary, thin, thick, hot, like ketchup, like mustard, etc., you just never know.   He ate a couple of bites and said that it tasted funny. It was slathered with BBQ sauce<br><br>He is from Brazil and is not used to the usual American way of notifying the staff when something is wrong.  I told the waitress, who was sympathetic but since we did not want to have them recook the burger (it was almost closing time--I do not like to ask a cook to remake something a few minutes before closing time.) she did not adjust the bill and it was brought right out.  Nobody asked if we wanted cheesecake, no refills were offered, just the bill, quickly and not by our waitress but somebody else.<br><br>I asked to speak to the manager.  When the manager came, I explained that it just hadn&#39;t been a very pleasant night.  He took the bill, and said &#34;Keep your credit card, I&#39;ll take care of this.&#34; and brought cheesecake menus.  My companion ordered a cheesecake, and they brought the bill, again.<br><br>This time there was a free cheesecake, but no accommodation on the burger.  Full price. $15, which is top dollar for a hamburger.<br>  <br>I know that mistakes get made in the kitchen, but don&#39;t make a big show of doing something about it when you are not doing anything at all.<br><br>Another  friend told me to call  the next day, because perhaps the manager just didn&#39;t have a chance to adjust the bill , so I did.  I spoke to a manager named Joe, who listened and said he would get back to me, and of course never did. <br><br>I understand you don&#39;t want to comp everybody who complains, but the error was clear, the food was made wrong.  I also don&#39;t mind paying for what was eaten.  I just don&#39;t like paying $15 for a burger that was not made right.<br><br>In my business we go by this philosophy:   MISTAKES HAPPEN  When they do:  1 Own it ,  2 Solve it Quickly,  3 Make it More than Right.   Something this Cheesecake Factory did not do. <br><br>I brought it to the attention of the waitress,  I brought it to the attention of the manager and I brought it to the attention of another manager the next day.  I did not make a scene in the restaurant, I was as reasonable as I could be.   I can only conclude that they dug in their heels and wanted that $15 real bad.<br><br>You saved $15 on a cheeseburger, but you lost this customer for life.

My friends and I are locals and we came to celebrate a birthday, it was 10 of us and they told us that the wait will be for 30-45 minutes, we ended up waiting 1 hour and a half. Once we got seated we waited another hour to get the food. We weren&#39;t happy and called the manager and the manager clearly didn&#39;t give a s**t, didn&#39;t want to make a small gesture, or not even an apology! We all are very disappointed and on top of that he pretty much said that we were liars and that we only waited 5 minutes. Who waits 5 minutes at a restaurant on the strip? Haha. <br>We won&#39;t be coming back, neither should you!

This Cheesecake Factory is always crazy busy and the noise level is over the top. I had the salmon which was excellent and my girlfriend had the chicken taco wraps which she loved and her hubby had the pulled pork sandwich which he said was good but my poor hubby had the macaroni and cheese hamburger which was not very good. The burger was so dry and the macaroni was not even edible! So disappointed!! We shared two pieces of cheesecake to go and the tab was like $100. Yikes!! Not worth it for not edible hamburger.
Great food, and drinks, great service from Destiny and Cornell at the Cheesecake in the Caesars Palace Hotel

My wife and I are visiting from California and decided to dine here for our last night in beautiful Las Vegas. The location is Amazing . We walk in and with perfect timing , the Atlantis show was going on outside the resturant . We waited about 3 min and we were seated without reservation. Andrew Nelson was my server he was amazing. He was so polite and made good suggestions. He treated his tables like if we were gold. Figure of speech.  Always smiled and took great care us. I can tell this man has a heart of gold. Thank you Andrew Nelson for this great dinning expirience. Staff was great and bathrooms were clean too. I&#39;ll be returning soon.

Was here last night for my friend&#39;s birthday dinner and had a blast. Despite the host attempting to seat us at an awkward corner, the experience was great once we got seated in a private booth. The food was amazing  (parmigian grilled chicken breast with mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables) as well as the sherly temple I had as a beverage. Second time coming to this establishment  (first time in Virginia Beach) and will definitely come back again....mainly for the cheesecake!

I love The Cheesecake Factory. Sure, the quality is not exactly sophisticated, each entree&#39; is worth a daily calorie intake, and the drinks are way too sugary, but boy they taste so good. The place is famous for its never ending menu, and enormous portions. It&#39;s all true, choosing an entree is hard, but you can&#39;t really go wrong here. I got the Louisiana Pasta, and it was so good. I couldn&#39;t finish my plate and since then all I can think of going back to TCF to get it again.

Like Cheesecake Factory&#39;s we have here in CA, delicious!<br>Oddly, we didn&#39;t have to wait to get seated (3 of us), we were prepared since it&#39;s in a mall and it was during the HOT summer we were here.<br><br>Service was OK, food was good though and came out super quick.

As an employee at Caesars I probably eat here twice a week. I order a kids chicken quesadilla which was 15 minutes late which in turn made me 15 minutes late from lunch. I asked for a side of salsa or sour cream and I was told it didn&#39;t come with it well I asked again seeing as I waited an extra 15 minutes for my food. I was still told no and believe it or not, I get to work at there was NO CHICKEN in the quesadilla. I paid $11 for cheese on a tortilla. Won&#39;t be ordering here again.
First off, best cheesecake ever hands down. I had the firecracker snapper &amp; the sauce was amazing! I&#39;ve been searching for it since. This was my first time here &amp; I loved it.

I suggest you request a table during the Greek god/fire show (whatever it is) they have right across from the restaurant. We put our name down towards the end of the show and as soon as the show ended the entire crowd headed to the Cheesecake Factory and the wait was over an hour. We waited 15 minutes. Also, request to sit inside and away from the show, the 2nd time around it started while we were dining and it was extremely loud and annoying! The food and service here was great. Had the salmon with lemon sauce, asparagus and mashed potatoes, so delicious and very filling. Didn&#39;t have room for cheesecake :(

They were quite busy but was able to get a table within 10 minutes! Don&#39;t remember our server&#39;s name but he was very nice and although he had to go through many other people&#39;s tables he went through everyone&#39;s table saying he had many tables to serve to warn us in case he may take quite a while. The food was very good! This Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t like the ones I&#39;ve been to back at home because they have more food options like calamari and nachos which my parents tried out and loved it! I went for the basic carbonara pasta with shrimp which is good as well! To top it all off, my server gave me a cheesecake and sang happy birthday! I wish I could come here whenever I want to have a good dinner but sadly I don&#39;t live in Las Vegas

Sangria and Red velvet cheesecake!<br><br>As I mentioned in another post I love this chain and wish they&#39;d come to Ireland. After dinner at Grimaldi&#39;s in the Venetian we came here for dessert.<br><br>Queued for about 40 minutes and got three seats at the bar.<br><br>I chose red velvet cheesecake and sangria.<br><br>Red velvet has got to be my favourite. Enjoy the pics ;)

We went there on our last day in Vegas, it is located inside Cesar palace, we sat outside, the atmosphere was loud but it was ok, I ordered the chicken Madeira, it was ok nothing special, my wife ordered the Jamaican black pepper shrimp, the rice was so sticky, we didn&#39;t like it.<br>Overall, I would go again but I might sit inside this time, it is kind of romantic atmosphere not like outside.

First, the Service. Party of 11: Four adults and the rest under 21: Occasion:  B-day party. The wait time was to be an hour.  It was more like 35 minutes.  Polite front desk and friendly. Seating was prompt and without hassle. <br><br>Our server - Sheena.  The epitome of exceptional customer service.  Sheena is the kind of employee that employers try to keep guarded from other employers trying to poach such employees. The kind of employee every business owner desires.  An employee that instills such a great experience on patrons/customers - that it keeps them coming back. <br><br>Sheena greeted our party with professionalism, courtesy, all smiles, articulate, and just the right amount of chatter.  She came across as a seasoned server that knew the exact amount of exchange and pleasantries necessary to make everyone feel welcomed.  From taking our orders for drinks and appetizers on to the main entree and desert.  Our drinks were always topped off and our table cleared of used glasses, plates and empty bread baskets only to be replenished without delay. Not a single person had to request service.  Sheena was always one step ahead. <br><br>Thinking of pepper?  Too late, Sheena is already asking.  Shredded cheese?  Too late - Sheena is already behind you with cheese shredder just waiting for your affirmation.  Question about the food?  Yup, Sheena is there with an articulate explanation of options/make-up of the entree. <br><br>I remember trying to think of any additional request - but Sheena was there - one step ahead.  We were so lucky to have been served by this great person.  Such a delight to have as our server.  <br><br>She worked our table like a ballerina - with the most exquisite detail to service. From the youngest patron, a 7 year old to my mother - everyone spoke highly of Sheena&#39;s performance.  The food, our drinks, deserts, everything was better due to Sheena&#39;s service. <br><br>The Food - Most started off with sot-drinks, while I enjoyed a Moscow Mule.  No copper mug but the Mule had a kick to it and not watered down.  For appetizers, we indulged in stuffed mushrooms, fried zucchini, calamari and artichoke?  The stuffed mushrooms were perfect and the fried zucchini was perfectly presented.  Just the right amount of crisp. <br><br>The Entrees included Chicken Madeira, Four Cheese Pasta (a favorite at the table), Steak Diane Scampi Combo, Fettucini Alfredo, Chicken Caesar Salad, Fish and Chips, Chicken Littles, and an assortment of other salads.  The Chicken Littles was quite the opposite of little.  My poor niece, who probably weighs less than 60lbs got full by just looking at the mountain of food on her plate.  It was an inordinate amount - much more than the typical Cheesecake Factory portion.  The food was very good.  Of course, we enjoyed our meal more due to the great service provided by Sheena. <br><br>For appetizers the selection was diverse - Snickers Cheesecake, Oreo Dream Cheesecake, 30th Anniversary Cheesecake (this is the one item I had second thoughts on - I should have ordered the Oreo Dream Cheesecake - the 30th Anniversary didn&#39;t have the sugar kick that accompanied the Oreo Cheesecake), Salted Caramel - probably one of the best choices for deserts, and the Birthday Sunday for the Birthday girl.  Served with black coffee to conclude this exceptional experience. <br><br>Thank you Cheesecake Factory and above it all - Sheena - just wow!  Thank you so much!  Entire family appreciate and thank you for the exceptional service.  Truly a unique experience.  That 30% tip should have been at least 50%.  Well deserved. Thank you again. <br><br>The Arroyo family.
My experience was Amazing thanks to our great server Thee Juan. He was very attractive, checked up at appropriate times, very joyful personality! The food was delicious as well!

The name says it all! Cheesecake everywhere! The sizes of these portions are massive! Certainly a two sitting or two person take down! There&#39;s a lot of variations to choose from. Great location and great atmosphere all round. Takeaway service available too f you want to divulge elsewhere!
Waitress was awesome. I ordered the cheese pasta with chicken and the carrot cheese cake. It was so yummy. I would definitely come again to try any of the other pastas.

I can order anything on their menu at any location and can expect to always have awesome meal with great service and this location is certainly no exception.  <br><br>Service was spot on, location was awesome next to all the great stores at Forum shops, and the food was excellent. <br><br>My favorite item has to be their chicken nachos...gotta try these! Main entree was the ribeye, seriously...for not being a steakhouse; their steak was cooked perfectly and had perfect flavor overall a perfect steak. I think they can give Flemmings and Ruth&#39;s Chris a run for their money as their steak is about $20 less and includes a side. <br><br>Once again...a Cheesecake Factory has provided an excellent experience and a desire to come back soon.

On a recent staycation to Caesars Palace, we had every intention on trying a nice restaurant, but we were feeling lazy and just wanted something easy and quick to eat. <br><br>They were packed for a Sunday, but we were seated quickly. My chicken and avocado club was standard, not a huge fan of the fries, but they were decent. My fella got the catfish, which seemed like an odd choice and he didn&#39;t care for it and ended up eating half of my sandwich instead. We also took a pineapple upside down cheesecake, which was really good and had lots of nice big chunks of pineapple in it.<br><br>The food was standard and service was as well. Good spot to go when you&#39;re inside the Forum Shoppes that won&#39;t break the bank.

Oh man, their menu is a visual maze but the food is definitely fantastic.<br><br>I think this is at least my 30th time at cheese cake factory, it just always ends up being the go to place for food for the people in my life. <br><br>I ordered the 4 cheese pasta and man was it gear. Very cheesy and very rich in flavor. I believe it was topped with ricotta and mixing that in with everything made the texture especially delicious. <br><br>Also had the margarita pizza. The thing about that pizza is it&#39;s not too heavy or greasy. The sauce is where it&#39;s at and its not a splatter of tomato sauce. It&#39;s smooth and hits the spot. Definitely a step up from cheese pizza, there isn&#39;t much of a difference anyway so I would say to just go for the margarita. <br><br>I ate an ahi appetizer, forgot what it&#39;s called but it was delicious... Except it was a tad bit expensive for the amount I got. I was expecting bigger chunks of ahi but I understand that ahi is an expensive fish. I have yet to really understand the world of expensive food but I am getting there. <br><br>Also the bread. Gotta love a place the gives out free bread. <br><br>Overall, great place. They have tons of options, so it can get overwhelming, but that&#39;s why I recommend trying new things! Just go for it!
I have been a fan of Cheesecake Factory for years.  And Las Vegas was having really bad weather that day.  There were extenuating circumstances.

Luv this restaurant!! They give free bread basket(wheat and sour dough) the wheat is the best.. I tend to eat too much of it by the time my meal comes I&#39;m stuff.<br>They have the best calamari appetizer compare to all the ones I&#39;ve tried.. It comes with their garlic aioli(always ask for extra cuz it&#39;s really GOOD)<br>My fav. Dishes are the Pasta Da Vinci, orange chicken, jambalaya and Thai Lettuce wrap( get the one on the skinny menu) cuz it comes with 3 wrap prepare for you.. If sharing w/ someone than order the regular menu cuz it&#39;s a huge portion which I could never finish..<br>Luv Luv their cheesecake..hehe.. Well the name say it all rt?? Pricey but good.. I usually get the fresh strawberry, banana, tiramisu cheesecake.. They have so many different flavor it&#39;s unbelievable.. For some reason I always order the same one..guess I&#39;m loyal..LOL
Great staff and ambiance. Food and service is always top notch at any location you go to as usual

This place is a promise for excellent food and service. We never got disappointed, the people in there know exactly what to do to please you! (Compared to the place in bocca park, there is some grumpy looking servers) <br>We visit this place frequently even the driving is longer for us but we always enjoy it.

Wow. I was so excited to visit the Cheesecake Factory in Vegas but never again. I&#39;ve eaten at Cheesecake Factory so many times in California because it is one of my favorite restaurants for the quality and taste of food, consistency, and service. <br><br>I always order a BBQ chicken salad every time I visit the Cheesecake Factory. The one I had in Vegas ruined this dish for me.  The salad was not fresh. The cucumbers were all soggy. Not only that, I found 4-5 lettuce head ends in my salad?! I&#39;ve never experienced this, EVER!!!! Upon calling my server and showing him this, asking him if this is normal he stated &#34; a few can get in there but not this many&#34; he just asked if I was done with my salad, cleared the napkin I had with the lettuce heads and proceeded to bring my check. Exceptional service... buddy. Oh and thanks not checking up on us once during our entire dinner.....So disappointed!!!!

I am no stranger to the Cheesecake Factory, we go to one back home, so I had no major concerns. We ate there yesterday and the atmosphere was perfect! We had a very polite and professional server. We arrived about 20 minutes before the heavy meal rush did. Thank Goodness! Every table was just about filled when we left. Food was yummy and in Vegas, it was a very cheap sit down meal compared to everywhere else.  We are here for over a week, so we will definitely go again. We reccomend this place!
Dont get me started ....The wait was long and it was 11 pm! We got there before a couple and they got served  before!  Bad service great food .

Excellent food as always, just writing this review to highlight the amazing service from DEYH, he&#39;s definitely the best Cheesecake waiter we have ever had (from all locations we&#39;ve visited). Good job!

The best experience I have ever had at Cheesecake Factory. After Carmines down the hall completely dropped the ball and lost 5 regulars, Cheesecake Factory completely saved our night out. The food was better than it normally is. It&#39;s always delicious but tonight our normal favorite dishes were absolutely flawless. The staff was top notch too! Especially the manager on duty who fixed a minor table issue, and our waitress who felt like a friend hosting a party. Unfortunately I did not get their names.<br>This location has always been a consistently good option, but after tonight, it&#39;s become one of our top dining choices on the strip.
Not the best service that I&#39;ve had a a cheesecake factory. We sat at the bar and no bread or food for 30 minutes. I still waiting for good service
Awesome food. Friendly staff. Great prices. Did lunch there and we had the Cuban Sandwich and Spaghetti and Meatballs. A much better alternative than the casino buffet&#39;s. And it costs less.

Las Vegas cheesecake factory was great! They sat us quickly, under ten mins. <br>It was the first time I tried the mushroom burger, I usually order the Cajun pasta and let me tell you I was not disappointed it was so good and full of flavor. To drink I had the pineapple Moscow mule and oh my goodness I loved it! Definite five stars.

This Cheesecake Factory has 3 entries on Yelp.  It was Happy National Cheesecake Day on July 30 &amp; July 31st, 2014 so I went over to a Cheesecake Factory (not this branch) to have a slice of cheesecake at 1/2 price!!<br><br>Anyways the following is my review for this location written back in February 2014:<br><br>I must confess that I am a diehard Cheesecake Factory fan!  Unless the service is very bad, I will not give them less than 4 stars.  This specific location inside Caesars Palace holds a special place in my heart, but I will not go into specifics.  Suffice it to say that I love this place!<br><br>Normally, I get here before it gets too crowded.  Sometimes I will have to wait, but it is worth the wait.  Will just wait and people watch or browse around some of the Forum shops til it is our turn.<br><br>The menu reads like a small book.  It can get confusing at times cause everything sounds so good.  Every appetizer and entree that I have had has not disappointed.  All are above average, and the portions are huge so come hungry.  <br><br>Of course, a meal here is not complete without dessert.  I will always save room for a slice of cheesecake.  If it means that I cannot finish my entree, then I will just take home the leftovers and enjoy it the next day.  I have tried over a dozen of their cheesecake flavors.  My current favorites are Dutch Apple Caramel Streusel cheesecake, White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut cheesecake, and White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle cheesecake.<br><br>I only have one complaint.  Stop discontinuing my favotite sandwiches.  They used to make a three cheese Grilled Cheese sandwich which was awesome.  They also used to make a Monterey Cheeseburger which was the bomb.  I truly miss those two items.  <br><br>With that being said, every time we return to Caesars Palace, going to this Cheesecake Factory is a must.  Many good memories here.
Very Good service and food !! The food was cooked to perfection! I felt good being here! Great ambiance!
Large menu, many choices never go wrong!! Short wait and good service and very generic menu good all over the country :)

Stopped by for lunch here after an afternoon of shopping around the Forum Shops. Though it was a Sunday afternoon they weren&#39;t ridiculously packed. We were seated quickly and were greeted by a very friendly wait staff. Our waitress was super nice and attentive. She was quick to bring by anything we asked for and was very helpful with helping us decide what we wanted to order. I wish they had a restroom on the first floor, but unfortunately you have to take the elevator all the way up to the second floor if you happen to be seated on the first and need to go. Other than that, the food and service is fantastic!

After walking a mile from the front entrance and getting lost through the gambling and shops as I was heading to dine here it was after 10pm when I arrived. There were many empty tables (inside and out), however, I was told that I would have to wait 25 minutes! This restaurant closes at 11:30pm. The servers looked like they should have gone home hours ago. They were dragging and mine never came back to see if everything was alright. It was not worth walking that far to dine there. Eat at another CCF where you don&#39;t have to walk a mile both ways.

I was here last night to have a dinner with my friends as they were craving pasta. We were quoted a 15 minute wait, which was pretty accurate. After a short wait, we were taken to a nice booth seat, and our server came right away. We ordered some cocktails and th buffalo chicken as appetizers. Their cocktails are pretty big for their price and they tasted very good- we ordered blood orange margarita, blood orange mojito and pina colada. With our cocktails, the server brought us some warm breads with butter, which were good as well. <br><br>The buffalo chicken was a deep fried dish of buffalo marinaded chicken chunks. However, there wasn&#39;t enough cheese or chicken inside the fried skin, so we had to end up just digging for the chicken to not get full from the fried part. As soon as we were done with our appetizers, our pastas were served. The portions were enourmous, like how cheesecake serves all their foods. <br><br>Along with two bowtie pastas that my friends ordered which seemed fine, my shrimp scampi failed. The angel hair was dry when serves, there was no sauce, and it seemed like it was waiting for the kitchen line for awhile to be served. The shrimp was not sauteed as mentioned on their description but it was deep fried-and remember their appetizer was heavily fried as well. There was just not enough sauce for the whole dish to feel moist. The shrimps were so heavy that it did not go well with the angel hair. Also, their garlics were not sliced at all; but served in chunks. <br><br>Their service was good, but if I were to go back again, I would stay with the skinny side of their menu, since they do not deep fry every ingredient.

Food was great . Original waitress was great . Food runner who dropped off food had a TERRIBLE attitude . The wrong item was brought out and when we were trying to explain to her that&#39;s not what we ordered she began to question if we told our waitress the correct thing &#34; and pretty much sighed and rolled her eyes with irritation. Spoke to a manager immediately . Hopefully this was dealt with worst customer service i ever experienced here.

For las vegas and in ceasar palace there something on a summer Saturday night you think you wouldn&#39;t have to deal with...such as two options we selected were out. The service was good and he was very attentive. First came across as not interested after stating we want desert only. We end up ordering food and he seems to be more happy. Flavor of food was ok and time of service on Saturday night was pretty quick. The pizza had half of crust burned but i don&#39;t eat crust. The food i wanted was out so i had to settle for quick selection.

I had visitors in town and decided to grab a table for 5 after spending some time in the Forum Shops. It took about 40 minutes to be seated, and after ordering a good 45-50 minutes for our food to come out. I would understand the wait if the restaurant had been very busy, but it was later in the evening and over half the tables in the restaurant were empty by the time we sat down. We also had a very simple order which included 3 burgers and a salad. The waiter never offered to bring extra bread for the table while waiting, nor did he stop by to refresh drinks. Our table was also half prepared and didn&#39;t even have napkins until I requested some.<br><br>Everyone was content with their food, but the poor service made the experience one I don&#39;t care to repeat any time soon.

As a tourist to a foreign land, one quite often uses Hollywood as a platform for whether it be tourist attractions, product endorsements and/or lifestyle changes. When it comes to eating, everyone from outside the United States would love to get served by Penny from the Big Bang Theory, which bought me to this little establishment about 4 years ago &amp; keep returning annually when I revisit the States. <br><br>Situated in the Caesars Palace forum mall, the Cheesecake Factory is located right at the end of the mall, right next to the huge fish tank. I somehow always end up with seating outside looking at the fish tank, which is fine by me as it is an alright view. <br><br>The service can be a little slow at times, but generally is pretty good. The quality of the food is great, and overwhelmingly large, however you come to expect that here. Just make sure that you leave a little room for dessert. <br><br>PS. The chicken Bellagio is probably better here than anywhere else in the country - as freaky as that sounds, it is true...

Really bad pizza,super slow serving cramberry is fake coke was not as normal 1 apple juice is 3/4water and  costs much the pizza was burned room tempeture is like it was inbtge freezer to them<br>I dont recommend  in,n out is way better!

DEFINITELY ASK for Crystal.<br><br>Superb service and recommendations. Just ask what her favorites Are and you will be in Heaven!!!<br><br>I&#39;m now an Addict...Thanks to her :)<br><br>She was quick, responsive and funny too.  Vegas best hidden treasure!!

This Cheesecake Factory is like all of the others. Consistent.  That is actually what made McDonalds famous- consistency.  It&#39;s very crowded, quite loud, and if you are lucky enough to get a patio seat you will be treated to the Poseidon show complete with smoke, water and flames. <br><br>My husband went with a chicken pasta dish, and I opted for the chicken tostada salad.  Both were good as usual.  The service was excellent, as it should be in a big hospitality based town.   <br><br>Is it flash, fancy or different-no, but if you are looking for a quick meal without breaking the bank, then here&#39;s your place.

My girlfriends and I found ourselves drunk and starving at the Forum Shops one Saturday afternoon. Too tired to find a cheap place to eat (which was hard in the Forum Shops) but not wanting to spend a crazy amount of money for lunch, we found the Cheesecake Factory! I know... we can find this restaurant back at home... but we were really hungry and the Factory never really had failed us in the past.<br><br>We were seated right away, and we sobered up quickly with their complimentary bread, lol. We decided to eat light (as we planned to eat greasy pizza later that night) so we ordered calamari and the luau salad, which were both very good and served in big portions. We ended the lunch with a macadamia nut cheesecake, in celebration for my late birthday with my girlfriends!<br><br>Overall, it was a good experience with good food and good friends. We&#39;re glad to have found this restaurant while super drunk. Thanks!

I&#39;ve been to many different locations but this one is by far my favorite. One of the ladies, Melissa, who often answers the phone and gives me my to-go orders is always friendly and helpful! <br><br>I wish they&#39;d offer an employee discount so I could justify ordering every day but the service and food is so good that I still order regularly regardless!

This Cheesecake Factory is located inside Caesars Palace and is absolutely beautiful! Eat outside if you can. We had no wait and our waitress was very accommodating. I ordered the Mexican Tortilla salad- delicious and fresh. As an appetizer we had the basil, mozzarella, tomato flatbread- also good but small. My boyfriend ordered the four cheese pasta with chicken- very tasty! Lunch portions are great. Of course we ended with Cheesecake and requested the key lime- tasted fresh and sweet and perfectly tart. Try the tropical iced tea too.

Last weekend we were in Las Vegas and came here for my birthday dinner. The food was delicious and the service was outstanding. This location is also so beautiful. I can&#39;t wait to go back when we are in town again.

Absolutely the worst service we have ever had. We always used to look forward to going here while in Vegas but will never go again. <br>When we went we were seated straight away even though the entire top section of the restaurant was closed which was unusual for this location. <br>After asking for the enchiladas with &#34;no sliced up peppers or onions on top but sauces would be totally fine&#34; we received a plate with plain white rice, 3 flour tortillas and some plain unseasoned chicken breast. No tomatillo sauce or salsa at all. When we sent it back the restaurant manager came back 20 min later, mumbled something under his breath and slammed down the same meal, cold with some tomatillo sauce thrown on top. <br>Probably the worst restaurant experience I&#39;ve ever had. Disgraceful.

Thank you Cheesecake for reaching out and getting further feedback for my review.  It is very responsible to connect with a guest and win them back.  I appreciate your attention to the matter and hope that the feedback will be use to further strengthen the team.  We will return.
Too many menu to choose. Our server Kathryn is wonderful . Love the bruchetta avocado

There are plenty of amazing restaurants in Vegas but we always end up coming here and sometimes more than once. The service and food is always consistent and always great no matter which place it is. There&#39;s an aquarium right in front of it so it&#39;s not boring while you wait and sometimes there are divers in there which is pretty cool. <br><br>We had the pasta with meat sauce, steaks and a mushroom pasta which were all amazing. I would come back again and again!

The one main reason I love Cheesecake Factory and the USA. PORTIONS!!! The food and service here were great!!! Price was reasonable. Did not disappoint on the dessert. Can&#39;t wait til Cheesecake Factory opens here in The 6 at Yorkdale

Literally just walked out of the Cheesecake Factory at Caesars Palace &amp; it was yum!<br> <br>They stayed open a little later than normal just because of the amount of people still eating.<br><br>We had the onions rings &amp; crab wontons. Also the skinnylicious chicken tacos &amp; salmon &amp; skampi combo.<br><br>The Chris cheesecake was delicious but very sickly sweet. 2 of use couldn&#39;t finish it. <br><br>Great meals &amp; great friendly service.<br><br>Ps: No wonder Sheldon eats here ! :)
We waited forever on the food. All 3 dishes cane out at different times. It was a mess. The manager never apologized. The waiter tried to make it right but was not successful.
This place has the absolute worst service. Management sucks. Their food is mediocre at best. I literally can not understand why they ever busy.

This has been the best food place in Vegas thus far. We came here for lunch ... the servings were huge, service was great and extremely inexpensive. ... we had 2 little kids with us and the staff was amazing. Recommend the spicy noodles with chicken and the pancakes.
Amazing customer service &amp; food. Loved the location. We sat on the patio &amp; it was a great atmosphere

Amazing! Having never been to a Cheesecake Factory before, I was very impressed. Prompt service, even with a long line. Got the luau salad for lunch, it was quite different but very tasty. I expected the prices to be crazy, but they were very affordable. <br><br>We were so impressed, we came back for dinner. The pasta was so good, Even though I was stuffed, the meal was so good that I couldn&#39;t stop eating. My husbands &#34;medium&#34; steak came out super rare, but he ate it anyway and said it was good. He didn&#39;t get any veggies with his steak, just a bowl of mashed potatoes, with a few onion rings plopped on top. Besides the weird steak dinner, the food was still excellent, as well as the service. Next time we are in Vegas, we will stop here again for sure.

Ordered a burger Medium Rare and my boyfriend ordered his cooked Medium - I said I didn&#39;t really want it too rare and the waitress joked that there probably wouldn&#39;t be much difference between the two. Well, there was a big difference because my burger came back raw in the middle. Raw. I wish I had taken a picture before sending it back as I&#39;m sitting in the restaurant at this very second writing this review. All we got was a sarcastic apology from the Manager. Never eating at a Cheesecake Factory again.
Good food, great service. I was expecting a bit of a wait for Vegas, but we literally waited 5 minutes. Spaghetti and meatballs were delicious as well as the lemon raspberry cheesecake.

The food at Cheesecake is good. This review is mostly for the service. It Was So SLOW!!!!  It was extremely slow. We had to wait for everything; bread, drinks, entrees, bill... it was ridiculous. We almost left before we got our entrees.

I&#39;m not a fan of chain restaurants for many reasons but I&#39;ll give an exception this time. For an appetizer I ordered the Portabella Mushroom Avocado and Zucchini Fries oh sooo good! Seriously you have to try it! For my main course meal I choose Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta! Now I can say why it was her favorite! It&#39;s now mines too! Lol pasta was more of a vegan dish since it had <br>Penne Tossed with Broccoli, Oven-Dried Tomato, Roasted Eggplant, Peppers, Artichoke, Kalamata Olives, Garlic and Pine Nuts. Ahh sooo good! And lastly for dessert my server suggested to try out their tiramisu cake, I enjoyed it it was full of flavor very moist and could definitely taste the coffee the only bad thing I&#39;d say was the waiting time it took about 50 mins to be seated we were given a receipt with a check back in time. We however used that time to walk and browse around the forum shops :)

This location is very convenient because it&#39;s inside the forum shops at Caesars Palace and behind the aquarium is the show depicting the Roman gods statutes. <br><br>The food was good and the service great.

Great place to stop and rest your feet in the forum shops. Service was great and the wait time wasn&#39;t long at all in all aspects - seating and waiting for food. The staff was very accommodating when we asked for a different table due to mobility concerns and didn&#39;t extend our wait at all. This place is consistently great and always a solid choice.
If I could give 0 stars I would have give it .<br> Disgusting food disgusting service .<br><br>Don&#39;t go in to this place .

Had a horrible experience here. Told it would be a 30 min wait for a table, 50 min later checked in and still waited 10 more minutes to sit down. Waitstaff was good with checking in, but our meal took 1.5 hours to get a salad and a steak. It wasn&#39;t the steak that was the hold up.. but the salad. Specifically the onions on the salad. I never received the onions after I asked for them to bring it out without them. My poor fiancés steak was lightly warm from being under the heat lamps waiting on my onions. In the past I have LOVED The Cheesecake Factory but I won&#39;t be dining with them. From now on it&#39;s Cheesecake to go-if at all.

Cheesecake Factory, Caesar&#39;s Palace, Table of Five, including three kids who eat from adult menu. Didn&#39;t matter, same as Boca Park, Cheesecake, you get seated in the worst booth imaginable, no matter how many booths are available. Go to this Cheesecake with a couple of kids, guarantee they stick you under the staircase, no ambiance. If you complain you&#39;ll be moved to the booth next to the Bus Boy Credenza (where waiters grab for utensils.) Go ahead, bet you I&#39;m right.  Has to be a Cheesecake policy-- both places? Listen to those forks and knives thrown into those drawers twenty, thirty at a time. Wonderful! Isn&#39;t it? <br><br>Server (woman about 50-60&#39;s) comes over to take order. She says, and I am quoting, &#34;So,&#34; as she turns toward me, her shoulders framing me out, &#34;Let&#39;s start with the gentleman.&#34; <br><br>I said, &#34;No, let&#39;s start with the ladies.&#34;<br><br>She was absolutely taken aback, instantly disturbed. Look on her face could kill.  <br><br>Sorry, but a gentleman always lets the ladies order first. It&#39;s not sexist. It&#39;s respect.

Ate here twice this weekend. Both times for lunch/brunch. I tried the chicken and waffles for the first time.  The waffles were a bit soggy and the hollandaise sauce was not very tasty. This was surprising considering the menu is usually on point. Fortunately, husband enjoyed the brulee French toast.

You know what you&#39;re going to get at a Cheesecake Factory - large portions and tasty food - and you know what you&#39;re going to get on the Strip - sorted like cattle, overcharged, and rushed. At this location, we got all of the first and none of the second.<br><br>They handle the crowds rather brilliantly - they take your name and tell you what time to come back, and when you return, you&#39;re swept directly to a table. It lessens the cattle-chute feeling when you get to just step up, step away, then return to be seated. We had a brilliant, wonderful waiter who nonetheless neglected to warn us we&#39;d ordered too much food, but laughed along with us when we were defeated by the portion size. He was delightful and friendly, like everyone else we spoke to there, despite the weirdness of individuals in crowds (if you have 17 adults and five children, you need to ask for a table for 22, not a table for 17 ya weirdo).<br><br>Prices were higher than a non-strip Cheesecake Factory, but not offensively so.
I like the restaurant and service at the Boca Park in Summerlin. Servers are professional and friendly. Food is excellent and you get top notch service.

The hispanic lady who handles take outs is antagonizing and pretentious. On a recent visit she made a racist comment when I was at the counter making an order and proceeded to chuckle at her own racial comment. Where the food is the level of service in Las Vegas?

This was a fantastic experience. I have never been to any Cheesecake Factory that was crowded and got seated in less than 10 minutes. I ordered the chicken and biscuit dinner with a honey bourbon  and it was fantastic. My Bay ordered an omelet and it came out hot.  The food was great and service was outstanding.

Arguably the best breakfast option on property. Had a minor issue at the start that was quickly resolved by Tiffany the manager on duty and our server Jessica Cherry who was brilliant and highly alert. <br><br>She provided us with great service and is a model of how an awesome server does their job. Ask for her and you can count on a great experience... And leave a big tip!!

I came here with my family!!! Met the waitress she is the best !!!! It&#39;s busy but she did a very good service !!! Thank you so much<br><br>Brianna the name of waitress she is the best lol thank you so much
Had a great evening while shopping in the forum shops. Great service and like always great food.

This restaurant really lives up to previous reviews. The restaurant is huge, and there are a ton of staff. The menu is a bit too big, but everyone will find something they like.
