I had the chicken bellagio, and it was delicious. My husband had the chicken madeira, and he loved it too. The portions were gigantic though, and it feels like such a waste. I only managed to eat about half. We shared the chocolate mousse cheesecake and the chocolate tuxedo cream cheesecake, and both were amazing. I&#39;m always impressed when such a big and busy (and afforable) restaurant can produce food this good. <br><br>Be warned the location can be a bit noisy, and I definetly recommend being seated inside. It&#39;s a busy place as well, but we only had to wait 15 minutes to be seated when we came on a Monday night.

Gotta say the food and service were excellent here. While yes this is a chain restaurant I do believe Cheesecake Factory in Las Vegas is one of the best places you can get a bite. My server Katherine was very friendly and attentive. <br><br>Trust me if you walk in from the strip entrance you will take a nice walk through the Palace Shops and earn that bite to eat for sure.
The Old Fashioned Hamburger was nice and juicy. The Original Cheesecake was delicious as always. Service was fast and attentive. Will come back again if in need of a cheesecake fix.

Only took 20 min to get my cold mac cheeseballs, the tase was ok, but being cold sucked. That being said it took 40 mins to get our food, which the server said the manager would be out to see us, which I never asked for, I just wanted my food. It came out,  the chicken was like rubber. Do not get the southwestern chicken sandwich. All their meals are over priced. Not happy. Never going back.

Wait time is long, everything else is fab.  <br><br>I came here with a friend and we met up with a party of 11.  As a large party and almost guaranteed a phat tip we were still treated pretty well.  I got the tuna and my friend got the miso salmon.  For some reason my tuna was cooked so you could see gray/white throughout, the last two times I had it where my tuna was red/rose.  I don&#39;t know what the norm is but they made it the way I wanted.  <br><br>You have to limit yourself to the food because the best part is the dessert!  It&#39;s not called Cheesecake Factory because of the pasta or meat or fish.  There are no items on the menu with name&#39;s like Cheesecake ahi tuna or Cajun Cheesecake Jumbalaya but White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle or Caramel Pecan Turtle Cheesecake!  Mmmm!!<br><br>So my fav:<br>Miso Salmon!!  Wasabi Encrusted Ahi Tuna!!!!  Steak Diane!  Cajun Jambalaya Pasta!  And the above Cheesecakes!

This place is a classic. You can literally order anything from their menu, (which mind you is HUGE, and has a little bit of everything) and be satisfied. So many great appetizers, and a good drinks as well. All in all just a great atmosphere and food, it&#39;s a perfect place to take the whole family.

Today is my mom&#39;s birthday so I bought the cake 59 dollar. They said cake ll b ready in 5 mins after that I don&#39;t know what&#39;s going on I have to wait forever they said they don&#39;t have a box for cake. I can&#39;t imagine what I got from them...I called manager and he treat me really bad. Cuz I look like kid...but doesn&#39;t matter ok!!!! I don&#39;t need free stuff just learn how to treat nice to customer!!!!

This place was busy for lunch but we were both hungry and neither of us knew what we wanted, so we came here.  As always, the menu is huge.  Service was fantastic and quick.  It wasn&#39;t very loud, and you can&#39;t hear anything from the Fall of Atlantis show that&#39;s just outside.  Both of our food dishes were very yummy and my Mai Tai was made superbly.  I would very much return, this is one of the best Cheesecake Factories I&#39;ve been to.

Just plain good.  I stopped in at Ceasars Palace location in the Forum for a quick lunch.  I am addicted to the Iced Mint Green Tea, and usually start with the Tuna Tartare.  For a non-sushi restaurant, it is not surprising to get a bad order of tuna that has been sitting around just a bit too long, but Cheesecake Factory has never let me down.<br><br>Today I deviated from my usual Garlic Shrimp Pasta, and tried the Enchiladas.  3 nicely done tortillas filled with chicken, and smothered in melted cheese, with a side of beans and cilantro rice.  Great fuel for the long walking distances in Vegas!

Cheesecake Factory has got to be one of my favorite restaurants! I loved it when I lived in Washington and I still love it when I tried it in Vegas. I am a big fan of there happy hour menu and drinks, very delicious. However if I have to choose my favorite by far... Has got to be the Luau Salad! So delicious!!! Nutty, sesame goodness with a thick layer of crispy wonton sheet and chicken breast. They have it in there lunch special menu as well :)

Always a good time here. Amazing cheesecake (salted caramel), prompt service and no complaints! The grilled steak medallions on the skinnylicious menu was a small serving but tasty. The cheesecake was so rich we split one slice 3 ways. Nice to be next to the Atlantis show outside.

I&#39;m so disappointed in my experience at this Cheesecake Factory. My friend and I LOVE Cheesecake Factory but now we have to rethink it as a favorite after this particular location. Customer service was subpar, we had to ask our waiter several times for bread and water, which he kept giving us ice water although we nicely asked for water no ice. No big deal but the little things add up. He was inattentive and he didn&#39;t even seem that busy because the tables next to us were also waiting on him. He didn&#39;t ask us if we wanted anything to drink besides water, and we didn&#39;t see him again until the courses came out. I went over to the bar and ordered my own drinks after 30 minutes of waiting. He rushed us out at the end. &#34;Are you ready for me to take this&#34;? But repeat 7x. Dude may have just been having a bad day but when the cheesecake tasted chalky at the end, I left feeling disappointed in the amount of money I spent. Even worse, I reached out to the Cheesecake Factory customer service team and never heard back.

Terrible service. Asked for bread that was never brought until the food despite reminders. Dinner orders were incorrect for 3 orders. Food was cold and by the time it was brought others in the party were done. No apologies nor explanations. I&#39;m usually pretty flexible but this was unacceptable.

Maybe you should fucking update this and let us know how long you&#39;re fucking closed for because no one fucking answers and the hotel operator doesn&#39;t fucking know and I waste my fucking time driving here after work and walking there to find out it&#39;s closed

Inexpensive for Vegas.   The food was decent, waitress friendly but a bit slow.   Not sure if it was anyone&#39;s fault as it was really busy.  Large menu, will have something to please everyone in your party.   Portions are large so I didn&#39;t get any cheesecake but the all looked amazing.
Wait wasn&#39;t long at all! Service was amazing and so was the food. Plus, there is a shopping center for you to browse while you wait. Definitely recommend!

I have been coming to this Cheesecake Factory for as long as I can remember haha It&#39;s huge with a &#34;patio&#34; area and 2 floors~ Inside is very beautiful too I hate how the restrooms are located upstairs though.. The wait can be long at times so we only come at odd times now.. I know people tend to hate on chain restaurants but I think CF is one of the better ones.. Their portions are huge and the food is tasty. <br><br>Must Haves:<br>-Chicken Madeira: Everyone&#39;s favorite. Its just 2 chicken breasts with madeira sauce, cheese, mushrooms, asparagus and mashed potatoes.. If I&#39;m trying to watch what I eat I substitute the mashed potatoes for broccoli.. <br>-Cajun Jambalaya Pasta: It is not too overly spicy and has just the right amount of kick.<br>-Chicken Lettuce Wraps: If I want something healthy-ish that&#39;s not a salad I get this dish.. It&#39;s huge so it will fill you up.. They even have noodles as one of the toppings.<br>-Carlton Salad: It&#39;s tasty and fresh but the dressing has a very strong sesame oil taste so you may want to ask for the dressing on the side or another dressing.<br>-Bread: Love their bread.. Especially the sweet brown one mmmmm haha<br>-Strawberry lemonade: Sugar rimmed glass.. perfect for a hot Vegas day <br><br>Service is always friendly and it&#39;s a fun place to people watch after or before you shop at Forums~ <br><br>HOT TIP: If you decide to get a salad you can swap out lettuce for mixed field greens free of charge.. yummmm ;]]]

We ordered a pasta to go for my niece. It was seriously so delicious. We got the tomato basil pasta. We got to watch the statue show while waiting for our order, so that was fun. (: They were also kind enough to give us some extra utensils and another take out container so we could share. <br><br>It came with bread and butter, but the bread was hardened, so not enjoyable.

When I stumbled into The Cheesecake Factory while checking out the shops inside The Forum Shops at Caesars, all I could think about was Penny and the guys from The Big Bang Theory. I abso-freakin-lutely love this show so you can imagine how stoked I was to find this place. <br><br>Nothing else mattered at that moment... I had to try it!<br><br>I went there twice and loved it both times. The First time was for dinner (and dessert as well merci beaucoup!) - I had their kobe burger w/ fries and it was pretty good. For dessert, I had their original cheesecake w/ Graham Cracker Crust and Sour Cream topping.... So good!<br><br>The second I went was in sometime in the morning and all I wanted was another cheesecake so I sat down and said to the waiter: &#34;Cheesecake please..&#34; He recommended the Vanilla Bean cheesecake so I went with that and it was amazing!<br><br>I wish we had one in Melbourne.. I really like it - the staff are very nice, I like the setup (nothing too formal nor too casual). It&#39;s a great place to chill and the price is quite reasonable too... I highly recommend it.

We went here because we had family in town &amp; they were staying at Caesars Palace &amp; wanted to eat here. It&#39;s nice &amp; big but because it&#39;s on the strip in the forum shops, the wait to get seated is kind of long. They have to call us on our cellphone to let us know when seating is available.<br><br>When you get inside, it feels kind of cramped. It took a longer time then normal to get our orders taken. The have a big menu. So much to choose from. They even have a menu for people watching their calories.  <br><br>For refreshments, I had the strawberry lemonade. It was super tangy. Very strong flavor. I&#39;m not sure if it&#39;s just me because I&#39;m pregnant &amp; my taste buds are more sensitive or it really is just super sour.<br><br>It took a long time to get our food &amp; honestly it wasn&#39;t very satisfying. Our appetizers were ok. I had the eggplant Parmesan &amp; it was bland but the linguini noodles was super salty. I couldn&#39;t finish my meal. The only thing I like about Cheesecake Factory is their cheesecakes.

Second time eating here, figured I&#39;d give it two tries before I wrote a review. I have heard about the restaurant very in depth through a class I am taking at UNLV and had to experience it first hand.<br><br>For starters the atmosphere of this restaurant is very appealing! A nice calm lighting with a warm and welcoming feeling.<br><br>If this is your first time, I recommend ordering an appetizer right away as it will take a good minute to look through the menu. This place has everything you can imagine and it all tastes amazing! <br><br>The food is mouth watering to say the least. The chefs in the back truly know what they are doing and really put their love and passion for cooking into the food. The waiters are also very pleasant and helpful. The prices for this location are very reasonable, especially considering its location along with the quality of the food. <br><br>If you haven&#39;t tried this restaurant and are considering it, do it! You will not regret that decision and everyone in your group will find something they like with the endless options in the menu.

The Cheesecake Factory is located in the Forum Shops of Ceasar&#39;s palace, way in the back behind the Zeus moving statues (keep this in mind when sitting outside, the show is every hour on the hour and gets loud!).<br>We went to the Cheesecake Factory, having never been to one before. As it was in Caesars Palace, I was expecting inflated prices, however I was pleasantly surprised with the menu pricing.<br><br>The spinach, artichoke and cheese dip was great and the pizza and jerk chicken for main were both fresh and tasty. We took a slice of cheesecake to go (too full to eat after the starter and main) and it was lovely. The price level was decent, especially considering the quality of food you get. A good experience!<br>Our waiter was fast and friendly and offered advice on the huge menu (I mean it when I say there is something for everyone!!). <br><br>My husband had the Meatballs, my sister had a pizza and I had a steak. All the meals were well prepared and very well presented. My steak was cooked as I like it, medium rare. Following the meal we chose deserts and again they were really nice, and surprising value.<br>The low light was the Fettucine Alfredo. Very little sauce, very little flavour. Very disappointing.<br><br>Both the meal and desert portions were large, perhaps a little too large for me and I have a great apatite.<br>The portion and value are great here and the food is very decent, though not so much on the healthy side (they do have a &#39;skinny menu&#39; meant for those who are calorie conscious).<br><br>The service was excellent and our server was very conscientious, always making sure we had rinks topped up etc.<br><br>All in all, the title says it all. &#39;Good Food, Good Value - Great Evening&#39;<br><br>We will definitely return to here.

The crispy crab bites on the lite appetizers menu are pretty awesome. You only get about 5 or 6, but they are super tasty and will not fill you up for your huge entree. I also ordered the Cuban sandwich. It&#39;s not your typical Cuban that&#39;s on a slim, pressed bun, but it&#39;s a huge sandwich that&#39;s you&#39;d get at a typical sub sandwich place. I was kind of disappointed by that since Cuban sandwiches should be made a certain way. It tastes good though!

The food and service is always great when we come here. <br>We got the garlic cheese bread as an appetizer: excellent!<br>I got the mushroom burger, which was delicious since I&#39;m a big mushroom lover. <br>For dessert, I got the red velvet cheesecake... Amazing!! <br><br>We will be back!
Great as usual. Gave suggestions of things to try. Boxed up the dinner and the food was great. Just a bit slow on coming around to the table but that&#39;s what you&#39;ll get on a Saturday night

I&#39;m generally indifferent to the Cheesecake Factory - to me it&#39;s basically two star food from a pointlessly long menu, served in ginormous portions in a painfully loud space.<br><br>This CF was better than average with really, really good service. We ordered Thai Lettuce Wraps and Summer Rolls and both were fresh and pretty darn tasty.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory still isn&#39;t my favorite, but this location is much better than most others.

Right from the start the service and attentiveness was great. We have two young children, one with diabetes, and the hostess and wait staff was very helpful with the timing and questions on the menu. Very cool being right next to the aquarium and Forum show. Styx was our server, and she was AMAZING.

I was craving cheesecake and well a trip to the strip happened!  We got there around nine  pm on a Thursday&#39;s night not too busy, and there was no wait time. However in case you come in a busy day there is always the aquarium and the show that happened to be conveniently located by the front of the restaurant to keep you entertain. <br>My boyfriend order a Long Island ice tea and I got a mojito. The mojito a was delicious ! We got the macaroni and cheese appetizer and since we were there for dessert the tiramisu cheese was our goal. The service was amazing and the atmosphere was relax since it was almost closing time.

I am giving ZERO stars (but it forces me to give 1) because I ordered a chicken caesar salad and it was almost $18.00 and had a shit-ton of lettuce but barely any chicken.  This was a to go item so clearly why don&#39;t you mess with the girl that won&#39;t open it up until she get back to work.  Thanks for the 6 pieces of croutons that you dumped in there and the crusty old bread that you gave me with it....totally worth the $18.00.  I&#39;m glad you put so much friggin lettuce in there.  This salad should cost a MAX of $8!!  Get that straight!i
Amazing food, always busy which might be a downfall because it translates to long waiting sometimes.<br><br>Yet I will always keep going there.

Great service as usual. TCF is one of the only restaurant chains that has good service no matter the location. They make dining options easy for me when I&#39;m somewhere unfamiliar. <br><br>Caribbean Cooler 10.95<br>Strawberry Lemonade 4.95<br>Tomato Basil Pasta 14.50<br>Fish Tacos 13.95<br>Caramel Macadamia cheesecake 7.50<br><br>51.85 pls tax

5 stars for the excellent service. Had an issue with my food and Ryan, the manager, came out right away to rectify the situation without me even having to ask to speak to a manager. I truly appreciated.

The Cheesecake Factory, located in the Caesar Shops was a wonderful place for lunch .  We had a Factory Nacho Plate and a Fig and Bleu Cheese Flatbread which were both eye-catching and delicious!<br>We were also served a basket of warm, tasty bread with fresh butter. As a bonus we were able to dine outside which allowed us to enjoy the large aquarium and the Roman God animated display which is a well-known part of Caesar&#39;s Palace.

Consistently good food and we were not waiting around forever to obtain a table between the lunch and dinner crowd. Still busy mind you! We chose the interior dining area this time and immersed ourselves in the lunch selections. MAN, this place has it all. HUGE menu. How do they do it all so well?<br>For $11.50 I chose a pasta special - spicy chipotle chicken. It was really good although the chicken was quite dry. I wish they would carry a lunch special with shrimp in it! The sauce was just enough and although it claims to be spicy, it is not so to people like me!<br>Our waiter was professional, pleasant and down-to-earth. <br>Very casual dining here.<br>My biggest complaint was the music playing. Awful, back to the era of Huckleberry Finn.

We live here in Vegas and there&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory maybe 10 mins away from my house but we drive all the way to the strip to come to this location! And especially for our waitress, Daisy. I always ask for her, she&#39;s amazing! Very nice staff! I&#39;ve only had one so-so experience there after being there a lot! Food is always fresh and tastes good! Pretty good on refilling the drinks quickly! Love this location keep up the good work!

***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 10/100***<br><br>I&#39;ve always been a fan of this place for those occasional calorie indulgence. We had family stay at Caesar&#39;s so we decided to dine in house. With reservations made ahead of time, everything was smooth sailing. I like that this location is quite large and that there are 2 floors of seating, although it can get pretty packed on the weekends and around dinner time. The menu is extensive so ordering is a task in itself lol. Somehow though, I always revert to my favorite Miso salmon, brown rice in lieu of white. Hubby got the Mac and Cheese burger which was cooked perfectly, rich and flavorsome. The madre got the Louisiana Chicken pasta which she thoroughly enjoyed. We also had a taste of the fish tacos which were surprisingly good, the cilantro rice is one of the best I&#39;ve tried. On the kids menu: chicken tenders and fries, well it&#39;s chicken tenders and fries, nothing much to elaborate. The mac and cheese that my son ordered was unsavory to put it mildly. It was dry and bland with no flavor profile at all. Our server must&#39;ve noticed my sons dislike as he took one bite and ceased eating altogether hahaha so he offered to get him something else, my son wasn&#39;t feeling very well so he opted for the bread basket instead. Our server informed us he would have the mac and cheese taken out of the bill, we told him it wasn&#39;t necessary but he insisted. A red velvet cheesecake was shared amongst us as we were too stuffed to order more. Service was cordial and timely despite the dinner rush. When the bill came and noticed the mac and cheese was not taken out, he gladly rectified the situation which in turn we added to his tip as we appreciated the effort and kind gesture.

This is a great restaurant inside the Cesar&#39;s palace mall..good service but the only thing I don&#39;t like is that you have to put away your own left overs. Beside that is a great place with good food.

I had a disastrous family birthday party for my son at this restaurant.  I contacted CF in March to begin setting up for a party in June via phone.  At first they put me through to the banquet manager which was a waste of time-I simply wanted to do a simple breakfast with cake/balloons etc.  my son was turning 4 and we had many out of town relatives staying on the strip that weekend for another celebration.  So we figured that this would be an informal gathering.  Finally the GM of the restaurant got in touch with me and gave me her email to begin putting together a more simple, appropriate, casual celebration for my son.  We emailed back and forth options for a special breakfast menu that they would print out that day-however they didn&#39;t have a file with the updated menu and pricing to email me.  After a month back and forth she finally sent photos of the menu for me to pick options.  Two weeks before the event a new manager took over the event.  Sarah seemed to have great ideas for the party.  I was ok with her initially taking over.  <br>The day of the event I showed up and was told that a female waitress would be in charge of the party. I was told to tell her all the things I wanted done for the party.  Well we never saw her again. We were given one male waiter for the entire party. We were never informed that he was taking over the party so I didn&#39;t know that I had to tell him all of our plans right then and there in the beginning. They brought out everybody&#39;s drinks quickly. Then they went to the other table as we had two tables for a party. That table had only adults and they said to let our table order first as we had small children. So we ordered, however they never went back to the other table. My brother came over that I had to tell him all of our plans right then and there in the beginning. They brought out everybody&#39;s drinks quickly. Then they went to the other table as we had two tables for a party. That table had only adults and they said to let our table order first as we had small children. So we ordered, however they never went back to the other table. My brother came over after 30 minutes and asked when we were going to order our food.  I had no idea that they had not ordered. This pushed off of us getting our food for an entire hour. I had over 20 people, some of them out from out of town, many of them toddlers waiting for an entire hour for our food. My son who was the birthday boy started to cry because he was hungry. This became very stressful. Also they only gave us one later for over 20 people. They could&#39;ve at least given us two waiters, one for each table. The descriptions on the menu did not fully explain what the food came with as a side. A lot of the breakfast items immediately came out with bacon. We had people in our group who are vegan and we had people who are not eating pork for religious reasons and cannot have it touching their food. So all those people had to send their food back and wait even more! By this point I was very frustrated. Going into the birthday cake, they had no idea what kind of a cake we wanted. However I had emailed about this months ago. So they had to go and get the cake ready and they lost the candle that I brought in with my sons age on it. This meant another half an hour waiting for the cake.  The service was the worst service I&#39;ve ever had in my life! I was so embarrassed in front of my relatives from out of town and I felt terrible for my friends who brought their small children and the kids have been fussing at the table. It was an uncomfortable miserable experience for all of us. I contacted the restaurant via email with all of my complaints direct to the manager that very night. I received an email the next day asking for my address and telling me she was sorry. The service was the worst service I&#39;ve ever had in my life! I was so embarrassed in front of my relatives from out of town and I felt terrible for my friends who brought their small children and the kids have been fussing at the table. It was an uncomfortable miserable experience for all of us. I contacted the restaurant via email with all of my complaints direct to the manager that very night. I received an email the next day asking for my address and telling me she was sorry. I assumed the reason that she wanted my address was to give me a voucher or something. I never heard from them again they never sent anything. After I spent over $300 in their restaurant you would have expected much better quality service. I was so disappointed I&#39;ve been going to the Cheesecake Factory for years. This was not my first special meal there, I had a baby shower there. I thought that they could handle this but clearly they could not.   I have not been back since and I&#39;m writing 6 months later because I still can&#39;t believe how terrible it was and I hope they get their act together.
Beware of up charges that are not explained to customers on phone in to go orders or listed in written form on the menu.

Excellent service, even for it being at the Cheesecake Factory. Our waitress was very attentive, personable and knowledgable about their menu. <br><br>This location is clean, very nice lighting that sets the mood for all types of dining occasions. <br><br>The menu is stellar as always with generous portions(even on the lunch menu). They are always adequately staffed and the wait times, even in the peak of summer was less than 20 minutes. <br><br>Wonderful representation of the Cheesecake Factory name.

We went to the new Cheesecake Factory across from the world Market Center. We sat in the bar so we could get in and out fast. We were there over 2 hours... We saw everyone around us being served and finish and we were not served. <br>When we asked the manager... Why it was taking so long, she said she would check! <br>She came back without our food. She said the time is only 30 min. Old. This was NOT cool. <br>We will never go back!!! If you want good service Do Not Go Here! The food was cold and not what we have received at The Cheesecake Factory in California!

Although the wait was a little long  the skinnylicious shrimp pasta was perfect and portioned appropriately. <br>Drinks were replenished consistently throughout the meal.<br>In addition , the others in my party ordered the enchiladas.. which were authentic to the taste <br>and the pot pie was amazing.<br><br>Despite the wait..it&#39;s a great place to eat!!!

We had lunch twice during my vacation in Vegas and both experiences were excellent! The staff was very friendly and attentive.  We were a group of 9 and we were still taken care of almost immediately. This location is inside the Venetian Hotel feeling like you are in Italy! We were also lucky enough to enjoy a show right before sitting down for lunch! If you are in the area I recommend for you to stop by and enjoy lunch or dinner!

I went here because I was craving drinks and appetizers and the cheesecake factory is always freshly made and doesn&#39;t suck. I was let down, the bread at this location was dry and tasted like it had been sitting out which is very unlike the locations in California I am used to. the rest of the food was alright, bit I feel like we either got an off night or this location is not quite up to par.

Came for dinner on 12/27/14.  Called from Planet Hollywood prior to ask how long the wait for 2 people would be, we were told currently it was an hour with no reservations available to make or give a name.  We made the trip over there, speak to the host and ask to put our name down for 2 people.  He gives us a look and a groan, so my response was &#34;what, the wait is now up to 2 hours?&#34;  His reply was &#34;Actually it&#39;s odd, I can seat you immediately right now.&#34;  WHAT!  Score!  We were seated in literally 4 minutes.  This must have been a rare case, because we ended up being seated still in close proximity to the host platform and all the rest of parties of 2 coming in after us were all being told an hour wait and to take their name down.  I guess we were just lucky.<br>All of the food was amazing, we had burgers and mac and cheese balls.  So good.  We ended up taking a few slices of cheesecake to go because he had a fridge in our hotel room.  The lemon meringue one was awesome!<br>We had a great experience!

I don&#39;t think there&#39;s any crime in eating at this chain restaurant while vacationing in Las Vegas.... It&#39;s good food, huge menu and affordable! The server was attentive and atmosphere was upbeat... And yes the cheesecake is a must even if you just get it to go... Do it.  We will be back!

I love this place. Their cheesecakes always hit the spot. It&#39;s hard for me to pick a favorite, but I really like the raspberry lemon, s&#39;mores, and pumpkin cheesecake! The veggie burger is really good thanks to the grilled onions in the patty, but as soon as you take a bite it starts breaking apart. We went on my birthday and they sang Happy birthday &amp; brought a complimentary sundae. I guess they don&#39;t do the free cheesecake anymore? The service was ok.

We have brunch at Cheesecake Factory every Sunday after Church unless we are out of town.   So while staying at Caesars Palace for a few days we tried not to eat at Cheesecake Factory but ended up going there twice.   Unlike Starbucks their menu prices were the same as home and the food was great, especially after  spending lots of money elsewhere and you were not too satisfied.<br><br>We love their warm wheat bread.  Service is always great.   Some of our favorite food here are Asian lettuce taco, fish and chips, grilled steak medallions, lemon ricotta pancakes, and fried zucchini sticks.
Tiramisu Cheesecake. Yummy. Even tastier when you have in an amazing locale as the Caesars palace.

Im here Johnathan M... a wonderful server... look yall, i came in here with major dizziness ... blood sugar was super low.. he gave me a basket of fries right away.  He suggested dishes that were amazing ans checked on my very often.. im not one to ever order desserts.. but i had to show my appreciation for this place. Johnathan is very informative and amazing!! What a lovely experiemce.. living here in vegas... im so running back to the strip for lunch often.. cheese cake... yall did good, Johnathan is wonderful

Don&#39;t eat at this location!!!!!!!!!!!!!!<br><br>What happend to us tonight was ridiculous! We were waiting one hour and half to be seated and after that we were one hour waiting to get a food. In the end we called manager to talk with him and it turns out that he told us we were waiting only 5 mins.So we  told him that we are unsatisfied and to help us at least with free drink on the house but he couldn&#39;t because in his system we were waiting only &#34;5 mins&#34;, so basiclly he called us liars. Customer service poor. He didn&#39;t even say sorry for your waiting or anything. <br><br>Wooow unacceptable!!!

Although my boyfriend and I eat at Cheesecake factory often, eating at this location was definitely an out of ordinary experience.Things that went wrong with our meal: first the bread was cold, then one of the dishes went cold while waiting for the other dish to be ready, and finally, I bit into half a toothpick that was accidentally left inside my chicken breast. <br><br>Yet despite the many mishaps that happened during our meal, our waiter and the manager provided the best service possible and were very apologetic. They redid both our dishes wonderfully and served as a new basket of bread. We even ended up getting the entire meal for free since the manager felt so bad for all the things that went wrong. 4 stars for the second batch of food and service! We will definitely be coming back during our next trip. :)

I had very high expectations. People are always bragging online about how they ate at the Cheesecake Factory and they take pictures of their food with Instagram filters. I thought it&#39;d be overrated and regular but I actually enjoyed myself.<br><br>There isn&#39;t a Cheesecake Factory here in AK so I had to give it a try while I was in Vegas. Ordered their Ribeye Steak medium rare with Mac &amp; cheese and Mash potatoes. I judge a lot of restaurants based off of their ability to cook steak correctly. I&#39;m no snob or highly experienced chef but cooking steak isn&#39;t exactly easy so if a restaurant can cook a steak properly, it gets major kudos from me. They not only cooked my steak perfectly but even the cut itself was of high quality. Maybe I&#39;m exaggerating but it tasted and looked perfect. The mac &amp; cheese was gooey goodness and the potatoes was good also. I ordered an Oreo Cheesecake to go which was fancy smancy yumminess but I expected that considering the name of the place. I wish we had one up here and I can&#39;t wait for my next visit.
Food was amazing other than the customer service not being so good @ first......... The cheese cake is 8.95 per slice I think that&#39;s kind of high. But it is what it is

I&#39;m giving this place a star because we were just a party of 2 who wanted &amp; tried moving to a booth for two when a waitress came up to us &amp; said  to sit where they assigned us &amp; we couldn&#39;t sit at the unoccupied booth without permission. I was like okay I was about to ask the host. The host said it was fine &amp; guess who was our waitress for the booth? The same rude waitress who told us we couldn&#39;t sit there meaning that it was most likely a part of her section. In my experience as a waitress, if my guests wanted to move to another table in my section they would be more then welcome to &amp; not scolded. The worst part of our experience was we ordered our food and didn&#39;t get it until about an hour later. After the wait, you would think the food would be prepared well but both of our pasta dishes were dry. We had our waitress bring it back &amp; the manager Aaron brought it to us &amp; apologized. This occurred after the screw up which took up to an hour plus of our time. After arriving at 10pm &amp; not getting our food till 11:10pm we were tired &amp; just wanted to leave because we literally were one of the last tables before close. Our food was packed with no silverware as well. It&#39;s sad because it was our first night in town &amp; we were hoping to be about but this cancelled our plans. Because of this experience, we won&#39;t be back at this location.

While wandering the Forum Shops my hubby and I worked up an appetite and wanted something easy and quick, but also want to sit down and park ourselves for a bit.  We saw Cheesecake Factory and that seemed to fit the bill!<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is a huge chain and so  you probably either love it or hate it.  In my opinion, the cheesecake is top notch!  Their cheesecakes are rich and served in huge slices that will satisfy any sweet tooth.  However, since I was jonesing for a Fro Ho at Serendipity later, I skipped it this trip.  As for the food, well, it is what it is.  The menu is HUGE (if you haven&#39;t been there it is a spiral bound book!).  That is great for variety, but other than the cheesecake they haven&#39;t perfected anything.  <br><br>This time out I had the Brioche Breakfast Sandwich with Hashbrowns.  It was good, not great.  They put tomatoes on the sandwich before they heat it so they get mushy.  Bleck!  The bread is good and the flavors work.  <br><br>We had good service and they sat us on the second floor which was nice since it cut down on the noise.  <br><br>Good lunch, nice easy stop in the Forum Shops.

So, the final verdict is out. 312 menu items, not including beverage offerings. Holy crap. If you can&#39;t find something you like at Cheesecake Factory, you are just a grumpy Gus.  I had the taco salad-type dish. It was ok - sooo much lettuce - but my friend had the Santa Fe sandwich, which he said was tasty. Wine was good and didn&#39;t break the bank. <br><br>This location is apparently the busiest in the world. I wouldn&#39;t doubt it... It&#39;s always packed.

Came by for dinner on a Monday night. Thoroughly enjoyed our dinner. Our server, I forget his name, was awesome. It was too loud in the area to be able to hear him unless he leans over and speaks up.. Perhaps it&#39;s just me and my hearing? *shrug*<br>I didn&#39;t have a big appetite that night. Just ordered something off their &#34;skinny menu&#34; ones with smaller portions and &#34;lower&#34; calories. Had the Ahi Tartare and the chicken and mushroom lettuce wraps. Both was enjoyable and was filling, for me. <br>All in all, very affordable, great for a date or with a large party. You have the option to sit inside or &#34;outside&#34;. <br>The restroom is upstairs on the second floor. Kind of a little journey just to wash your hands!

So it&#39;s our sons 16th birthday and he wanted to go to the Cheesecake Factory. Please keep in mind they don&#39;t take reservation and of course it&#39;s Friday night. So we arrived at 730ish and the wait was 35 plus minutes for 7 people. Our server Shawn M and he was no doubt one of the best server we&#39;ve had in a long time. Shawn got us drinks and took our appetizer order which was very fast. After we ate our apps  we order dinner and waited waited waited waited for bread to come. Finally it arrived. Soon after our dinner came. It came in stages we got two entrees first and two minutes later got another two entrees and another two minutes later we got the other two. So six minutes total to get 6 out of 7 entrees. Well after 13 minutes later we finally got our last entrée and the manager brought it to our table and tried to make a joke about what happened verses apologizing. So bottom line 4 or more guest watch out.... Service AAAA+, Kitchen they no doubt have issues. Regardless how busy you are you have to be on point....We will not be back anytime soon. So if you have a special occasion and have 4 or more guest go somewhere else!

Just ate here and the waitress service was PHENONMINAL (Destiny), but when it came to the kitchen staff, the manager and the supply of food was ridiculous for a Valentines Day. You know its a holiday be prepared. Two of our fav. Items the cheeseburger egg rolls and the buffalo blasts were completely out, wouldnt you order extra of everything knowing this is Valentines day and also Las Vegas. Ordered our sons corndogs as soon as we sat down since he was fussy and we ordered the rest of our food 15 min later. All of our food came out before his three lil corndogs from the kids menu. The Manager Brandon did come over and apologize twice an apologized for the lateness but he stated that we make everything fresh. We had six in our party plus our son where all the other food that was ordered later came out.. Dont give people excuses just be honest and straight forward with what happened. I have been coming to the cheesecake for years and have never had an experience like this one. Way below expectations and the standard I know they have.<br><br>Wont be returning to this location if I do return to a cheesecake factory. I am a local to las vegas and was taking relatives from out of town to eat i guarantee that will not happen again at this location and potentially any cheesecake factory..

I absolutely never in a million years thought that I would give a Cheesecake Factory 5 stars.  I was in Vegas for the marathon and my friends and I needed to find a place to eat the morning of our race.  I didn&#39;t want to do a buffet and I also wanted something very plain and simple due to the fact that 4 hours later I&#39;d be running 26 miles.  <br><br>We stumbled up Cheesecake Factory and I honestly had low expectations, but I was extremely wrong! Times have changed and while the pasts is not vegan and like pretty much no entree is veganizable - I had a great meal! our server was amazing - she pretty much just created a vegan feast (plain and simple though) out of sides, appetizers and salad. <br><br>I had a great meal and a great experience - but um hello potion sizes there are huge!
I like this place. It looks nice. And most importantly, the food is very tasty, whatever I ordered. And you should definitely try the cheesecake there.

Worth service ever, we wait 45 minutes for appetizers and over an hour for the food. I told the waiter I have milk allergy and he served my chicken with cheese, my sisters order steak and didn&#39;t get steak knives. Waiters brought the check with out pen. Manager was rude and smell like ashtray, I guess he was mad we bothered him during his smoke break.

There isn&#39;t a Cheesecake Factory in my city, so I don&#39;t mind one bit visiting this one when I&#39;m out in Vegas. Though it&#39;s location at the very end of the Forum Shops at Caesar&#39;s is a bit inconvenient, the longest I&#39;ve had to wait for a seat was 40 minutes even during busier seasons (once for a party of 11 and once for a party of 4).<br><br>Both times I&#39;ve eaten here, the service was impeccable, and of course the portions are huge, the food tasty, and all well worth the price. My friend swears by the Chicken Madeira, though I never order it because I don&#39;t eat mushrooms. The mac-and-cheese burger is delicious, as is the chicken burrito (though I would have preferred it to have shredded chicken rather than cubed). I also really enjoy the Flying Gorilla alcoholic milkshake.<br><br>I don&#39;t eat here EVERY time I go to Vegas, but it&#39;s definitely a good option, and probably one of the better ones in regards to price - especially in the Forum Shops. Again, I can&#39;t stress enough that both times I ate here the service was great (in a town where I usually find the service to be average at best).
Had a delicious meal here for my birthday. Prices are on the high side but standard for Vegas and worth it to splash out on the amazing Reece&#39;s PBC Cheesecake!

Ate here for a late lunch.  Waited about 10 mins for a table.  Service was a little slow to start but our server quickly picked up the pace.  Fried mac-n-cheese balls were amazing as was the Parmesan cheese bread.  We also had a slice of cherry cheesecake and a slice of banana cream cheesecake.  Both were delicious.

Cheese cake factory...The food portion here in Vegas is great.<br><br>Hostess, waiter and waitress are friendly.<br><br>I over heard my waitress... We have bigger portion for the tourist. Good job.<br><br>:(  my little brother took care of the bill ahead of time... <br><br>This is a Chinese thing... We pay ahead of our relatives or leave our card with our host to avoid the battle who will pay the bill.<br><br>We spent $125 and little did we know that during the course of the dinner we were served a dish with curly hair... CURLY ones...<br><br>As soon as we saw the curly hair, we brought it to our host... The manager came and to make it right he gave us a free slice of cake. <br><br>This is VEGAS!

Cool place to eat! Usually when i&#39;m at caesars palace i always stop by here for dinner with friends! Prices are reasonable which i like and bartenders are friendly. Sometimes there is a LONG wait so get there early on a friday or saturday night

Pretty horrible service tonight, came out for my birthday dinner. We had to wait 45 mins to be seated which is understandable. But had to wait 15 to get water and bread and over an hour for our food. It took the waitress over 20 minutes just to bring us our card at the end. Really awful and kind of ruined my day. :(

My husband &amp;&amp;I eat here at least 3 times a month. Often catch Floyd Mayweather &amp;&amp;his &#34;money team&#34;. The service is exceptional. One night I guess a server dropped my husbands filet mignon &amp;&amp;the manager came to apologize comped his plate &amp;&amp;offered us a free slice of cheesecake. We&#39;re not dessert eaters so we took the comp gladly. If you go later in the night, like two hours before closing, there&#39;s usually no wait.

Went on a Friday night around 6pm. Food was great. I had the bam bam chicken and shrimp. It&#39;s was amazing I would definitely recommend it if you like the Thai  coconut curry. Our waitress Jasmine was very good, we asked a lot of questions and asked for some recommendations and she did not let us. She kept coming back to check on us and kept our drinks filled. She her self gets a 5 star from  me. I brought back some cheese cake to out room. After the long walk back the cheese cake was just what I needed. Thank you jasmine and the Cheesecake Factory staff for make our experience enjoyable
Food was delicious, service great, consistent just like All the other cheesecake factory.<br>Sweet brown bread was so good, pasta perfect! <br>Love their blueberry &amp; white chocolate cheesecake!

Pork Belly sliders pretty good with fried pickles and coleslaw. Four good size sliders. French Country salad with beets, goat cheese, asparagus, and pecans had sparse ingredients and under-dressed. Crispy Pineapple Chicken and Shrimp with sugar snap peas and shiitake mushrooms in sweet and spicy sauce served with white rice came with super dry chicken bits, no shrimp, and uncooked rice. Server told manager who ordered just shrimp to add onto my plate, but they redid order with more dry chicken, but no pineapple which made the sauce taste different. I had to take from new plate and dip into sauce of original plate. I&#39;m not sure what happened but I think I got three different types of shrimp. Some were medium size, others super small, and one larger one that had the shell including tail still on. I think maybe they were out of shrimp and sent original plate out hoping patron was too drunk to notice there was no shrimp. It is just sad that if you were going to fake a dish that you would at least cook the chicken well. Neither the server or manager cared to notice I barely touched the plate. Btw, you&#39;all need to trim your sugar snap peas so it&#39;s edible and won&#39;t choke anyone.

I always hear great things about The Cheesecake Factory and finally had the chance to try it for myself and I was not disappointed! Our waiter, Juan, was so helpful w the menu and w any requests that we had. The menus are super cute and organized making it easy to navigate. Our food hasn&#39;t come out yet, but I don&#39;t have any doubts that it&#39;s going to be mouthwatering

THE worst manger I have ever dealt with EVER. I had a party of 8, 2 were in the bathroom and they refused to seat us until 90% of our party was here. They finally seat us after 15 minutes (as we are still waiting for the 2 in our party). They give us 2 booths back to back. We wanted a table together. We saw 2 tables so we asked our waitress if we could connect the tables and sit together so she went to go ask. In the meantime we start setting up the tables. The manager (Amid which refused to give us his full name) walks up to all EIGHT of us (this is the first time I&#39;ve seen this man) with an attitude and starts saying very rudely get up, no this is not what we agreed on either move tables or don&#39;t dine with us and get out. My sister calmly says we did not agree on anything and I have never seen you before. I dealt with the hostess. He says no no no and does not let my sister finish her statement as were walking away my brother asks what is your name I&#39;m leaving a review he says Amid we then ask what is your last name he then proceeded to say I will not tell you we go back and forth for five minutes then says get out or I&#39;ll call security.<br>Now to me this is no way to manage a restaurant I felt disrespected. <br>I would definitely not recommend this location!

I can&#39;t say enough about this restaurant. It&#39;s a must visit anytime we are in Vegas. It has a very expansive menu and anything I&#39;ve tried has been a hearty portion of excellent food and I find the prices are more than fair, especially compared to other restaurants nearby. It has a cozy ambience in a very cool section of the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace. Typically we have had to wait to get in but this trip we got a table right away. With the huge potions it&#39;s hard to leave room for the cheesecake, but in the past we have walked from the Mirage or Treasure Island just to get a piece.
Had the half turkey sandwich lunch special with french onion soup and a caesar salad. Everything was wonderful from the food to the customer service

First timers in USA. Had this twice at the Vegas north premium outlet branch. I think they just opened this new branch as part of their new expansion. We were pleasantly surprised that the Coke were refillable, the portion here were ALL SO HUMONGOUS, we had a hard time finishing our food. We particularly liked the nachos--they were crisp enough, well salted, and huge in size! Prices are reasonable too. We loved the attentive service also. Well recommended for a hearty meal, I think most people will have smth inside the menu to satisfy their craving.

Enjoyed our meal but very poor service. Was seated with Lara J. After she took our order she disappeared never came to check on us, waiting for her to refill our beverages for a long while. The whole time watching the other waitresses tend to their tables. When she finally came back it wasn&#39;t until we were already almost done with our meals. It just seemed like she didn&#39;t want to tend to us at all.
Our server was very patient with us considering that we were part of a big group but separate table.
They don&#39;t take reservations per James but he said for a party of two it would not be more than a 10 min wait. Ok we will see. Great service and great food

The manager came to us and asked us to move and we had asked why... he was aggressive cold and one worded. We had waited 35 minutes to be seated, I would think we can get an explanation. We are confused and he refused to share his full name , why we need to move and if somehow we could meet in the middle. He was more aggressive than anyone should treat anybody even outside of a restaurant. I am a regular and this was disappointing. His name is Amid! Now....I understand that people can be overwhelmed but no other cheesecakes who handles the same amount of stress would treat us the way he did. I&#39;m am shocked. I literally don&#39;t want to support cheesecake if this is what they allow to handle the customers and certain circumstances. I would think a manager is hired to handle special situations accordingly. Not rudely and aggressive or cold. I&#39;m shocked that cheesecake can allow this.

Waiting time was 3 hours but, then again it  was the 4th of July<br>Angel hair pasta was very salty, notified our waitress she just apologized, my son had the chicken piccata and was so salty as well<br>Tell your waitress to make sure pasta is not salty<br>Utensils were all dirty including my plate<br>Overall food and portion is always great here

We went here while shopping in the mall. No wait for lunch. Food came out quickly. The prices are relatively close to our local CCF.  I would say about $2-$3 more each item. But love CCF , they never let us down.

Why go to the Cheesecake Factory? I mean does it really have something that special on its menu that is worth the trek or the wait for a table? No, it doesn&#39;t have the charm and the allure but it does offer a wide ranging menu that is sure to please, decent service, and most off all: consistency. <br><br>The menu is overwhelmingly large. Whether you want appetizers, salads, sandwiches, pastas, entrees, or more they will have it. Tacos? Shepherd&#39;s Pie? Chicken Milenese? Yes, they have it available on their menu. While it won&#39;t be the greatest you ever had, it certainly won&#39;t be disappointing and offers decent flavors. <br><br>Service was good and like other locations, its saving grace. We were the last party to be seated and they didn&#39;t hesitate to be of service nor did they try to rush us. They were attentive and water glasses never went empty. The food arrived in a well timed orchestration and was where the restaurant clearly shined.<br><br>All in all it was consistent. It stayed true to the Cheesecake Factory experience and didn&#39;t disappoint, yet at the same time didn&#39;t wow either.
Ok now they start me with bread, which the crust was very hard to the bite on the other hand I ordered the chicken gumbo, which is my personal favorite and it was always to my liking.

Great food. Great people. Open late. And they have happy hours and deals on certain things. Foods of all kind. And they change the menu a lot. So you can always find something new to try. Definetly a place for dinner parties and families. They also have a show right in front for the tourists since we r in Las Vegas Baby!!!!

Went here with my parents after a long morning walk. Service was great, food was great. Dad and I had the crispy chicken sandwich with chipotle, he had fries and I had onion rings. Mom had special.... small sandwich with salad and potato soup. The fries and chicken sandwiches were excellent! The potato soup was the best mom had had at a restaurant. The salad was good as was her sandwich (turkey, I believe). The onion rings were ok but had a lot of batter and not a lot of onion. I would get the fries next time. If you&#39;re able to stay for the &#34;moving statue&#34; show, totally worth it. Loud but really good atmosphere and plenty of people watching.
The Cheesecake Factory is always good for me ! One of my favorite places. Good food, good service.

Came here to celebrate my birthday. Had a waiter named James G, as it reflects on the receipt. I mentioned to him that it was my birthday 3 times. I hear the &#34; Happy Birthday&#34; song being sung several times around me. All he did was talk...not listen...talk. Customer Service is listening to the customer, hearing different hints and she&#39;s. He didn&#39;t get the hint that it was my birthday after mentioning it 3 times. He told me I should have requested it, and they would have relayed the message to him. Why does someone have to relay him a message when I said it several times? No one else asked. Their waiters knew. I didn&#39;t ask. I told him he had 1 flaw. Not hearing me mention it 3 times. He had some excuse on why he didn&#39;t do it. Several excuses. Because he didn&#39;t want to ruin the surprise. Well...it&#39;s not a surprise if I&#39;m telling you, but good excuse though. Thanks for making my birthday night memorable James G.

Expected long lines but we were surprisingly seated within 15 minutes.  Instead of pagers, they just tell you to wait near the bakery behind the hostess.  Our server was attentive and the food was great.  I love Cheesecake Factory but I typically never go to this location because there are so many other places to try out in Vegas.  Since I had 2 picky teens with me, I figured we could please all palates here and have something to do afterwards in the Forum Shoppes.

Probably the best value resto @ Caesar&#39;s lol without breaking an arm and a leg.  Sure it&#39;s not dirt cheap, nor should it be for such a higher-end casual chain, but at least you&#39;re not paying $50 per entree @ Gordon Ramsay, but I digress.<br><br>The usual pricing and big portions.<br><br>Located at the way back from the Forum Shops, and liked what they did with their patio; it&#39;s massive enough to soak in all the eye candy that Vegas has to offer at this time of year.  Don&#39;t know possibly how one review said it&#39;s quiet in here.

Great as always. I&#39;m forever recommending their Ceasar Salad, fried mac and cheese balls, and Red Velvet Cheesecake. The only flaw is their seating. If you&#39;re upstairs near the railing, be careful. There&#39;s nothing covering the fence part, so if you drop a knife (as I did) you /will/ hit someone. Luckily, it landed between her back and the booth but still. They need to fix that. After the incident, the manager just told me to keep my silverware away from that side to avoid another mishap. <br><br>That mishap would never happen again if they fixed that, but still. Always A+ food no matter the location. The staff is super friendly. :)
Friday Night, great service, very personable, kept drinks full. Called people by name as he handed credit cards back.

I walked in with my daughter and this waiter Chris made sure that I will get the right order the way I want it. He carefully asked for my preference and made awsome effort to achieve what Ive wanted. Very attentive and pleasing service. Unfortunately, we had to change server because of the sitting issue, then Phil was the one that replaced Chris and he provided me the same excellent customer service. I was very happy as Iam not a local I like to have pleasant moment during my vacation and one of them is dining with great experience at restaurants that I like. <br><br>I give 5 star to these men who provided excellent customer service to their customers and willing to make efforts all the time!!!

My husband &amp; I couldn&#39;t believe how well we ate for the price we paid. The service was very good, the atmosphere was not loud despite being located inside the Forum Shops &amp; our food was wonderful!

First time eating at Cheesecake Factory. I ordered the bacon bacon cheeseburger and it was so good it rivaled a Gordon Ramsay burger and I love Gordon Ramsay burger. Service was good and restaurant was clean.

Michael is serving us right now (10 pm 7/12/17) and he is so professional and charismatic! My family and I are locals and this is one of our favorite cheesecake places because of the great service employees provide! My mom forgot her reading glasses and he was so kind to offer his so she can read the menu. Haha thank you, Michael!!!

This is a cheap spot we visit all the time when in Las Vegas...we usually visit Las Vegas for spring break since my son was 9years old....but now that he is in college he do different things for spring break.  The food is fool proof...I order 1 of 2 items the Louisiana chicken pasta or the Jerk shrimp...both are really good in my opinion...our last visit we had the most amazing waiter and the best margarita!

Although the wait was pretty long, (hour and a half for 6) my family enjoys dining here whenever we&#39;re in Vegas. Food seems to taste better here than the one in California. Service was good and my medallions were a perfect medium rare :)

The food is great as always but the manager was rude and not understanding. They said its a half hour wait to eat on the patio and hour wait to eat inside, we waited the hour to eat inside and they placed us at a table in the doorway-half of us sitting inside and half outside. Very awkward seating and the manager told us we either take this table or leave. We had waited so long we stayed to eat but it was awkward the entire time, being bumped by waiters coming in and out
Had lunch and had the philly cheese steak. The menu is huge and you will have plenty of good food to choose from.

Love this place. Ate here twice in a 12 day vacation in Vegas. Have previously eaten multiple times at the one in Orlando and they&#39;re both of same great standard.<br><br>Food is reasonably priced, delicious and generous sized portions. In previous orders I&#39;ve had the mushroom burger, Kobe burger, bbq chicken pizza and some sort of pasta and each dish was delicious. I&#39;ve never had a bad meal here. <br>The service was fantastic too!<br>I&#39;ve tried the vanilla bean cheesecake twice, the carrot cake (not cheesecake) twice and the red velvet cheesecake once.<br>The red velvet was the least favourite of mine but the carrot cake is probably THE best carrot cake I&#39;ve ever tried anywhere and the vanilla bean cheesecake flavours are to die for, delicious! <br>The location in Vegas has two floors so plenty of space to get seated even if it is busy. <br>Wether in Vegas or Orlando the Cheesecake Factory is my go to restaurant when I have a sweet craving!
We were originally told there would be a 2 hour wait for our party of 8, however it only took 35 minutes. Nice! Service was good, food tastes great. Cocktail yummy!

Went on a late datenight and waitress gave me ore attitude than a hungry 5 year old. I understand that she might have had a long day but honey you are in customer service if you are not up for it take time off not give attitude to people who pay for your paycheck. Food was amazing as always

I like this restaurant&#39;s no matter where they are they have good food but today was the worst experience i ever had<br>Food 5*<br>Service -1*<br>The waiter and the manager where not for that job,they knew nothing about how to treat people.

Went last second on a busy Saturday night , party of 8 and bday for the 15yr old favorite spot . Last second we didn&#39;t know what to expect . We were told 2hr wait at 7pm arrival. So we gave name and walked the shops .. 20 min later we get phone call table ready in 5 min .. Wow great job. We immediately head back.. Waiter was great and attentive to all details of are party and age group ordering . Was a great night . Food was on point , appetizers properly timed and drinks were always full. Even had cheesecake to go! Nuts and creme offered . They nailed it in every way. So glad we left name and number and took the chance of them calling early. Great job ! We will be back. Waiter even hooked me up with a nice glass of cold milk!!

Top to bottom- very, very good!<br>Food, service and value. Inside the Forum Shops make it doubly as fun!<br><br>Don&#39;t miss it.<br><br>Although the day I was there the womens bathroom was flooded and I got some gross stuff on my feet...yuck!

So tonight was CONFUSING. I walked in, gave my name, waited by the bakery. My name was called. I was told to walk upstairs. I waited AGAIN upstairs. And then asked to sit in an overcrowded, stuffy, overflow room.  And get this, the table was a small 2 top right outside of the kitchen. Literally, 3 steps out of the kitchen. Lord forbid a waiter trip or a cup of coffee slip off of a tray, scolded wouldn&#39;t even be the word.<br><br>Myself and my guest I was with, just left.   As we walked down the grand staircase, we walked past a manager that didn&#39;t even take the time to say goodbye or ask about the meal. The gentleman that directed us upstairs didn&#39;t even take the time to ask why we were leaving so soon, but instead &#34;I hope you enjoyed your meal!&#34; Bro, we weren&#39;t even here for more than 10 minutes.<br><br>Ultimately, I get that this location in Vegas is busy, but why is that? Cheesecake factory is a staple in every major city, patrons will eat there no matter what city they are traveling to.  But what i don&#39;t get is how the customer service can waiver between the different locations.  Just because the Vegas location stays packed from open to close, shouldn&#39;t mean that the hostess cannot take an extra moment while asking a name, &#34;just to let you know, we are seating in the upstairs overflow room, is that okay? Or would you prefer to wait for a table on the first floor?&#34;  This one question would have given me a 5 star experience because I would have elected to walk up approximately 42 stairs and sit in a separated environment.

Came here for a quick bite to eat before a show.  We got seated fairly quickly as there wasnt much of a wait.  The menu has changed a lot since I&#39;ve last eaten at this chain.  I went for a chicken dish which was breaded chicken with pasta topped with tomato sauce.  It was pretty tasty but as usual the portion was huge!  The fettuccine alfredo was also pretty good as well.  The service here was good and polite!

I love this restaurant! First it&#39;s mostly only a 5 minute wait because the restaurant is huge Second service is great. Also, the restraint is clean and the food is great. Plus if you get a view outside you&#39;ll get a view of the show or the huge aquarium.

I just finished dining there, and due to the long wait chose to sit at the bar. I just wanted to tell all that I thought the bartender was fantastic, I was there just to zone out, and not be bothered, and he did both. Very friendly, engaging with all the customers, but left me and kept making sure that my drinks were filled until I was ready to leave. Then once I was ready, checked me out got me on my way. Even took enough time to notice my name when I paid (with my credit card), and thanked me for coming in my name. Of course I didn&#39;t have catch his but great bartender!

I went on a Tuesday Night and all I can say is that this place is poorly managed. I will never attempt this place on a weekend, because the turn around time is slow. Starts off with the front desk which has a poor system of seating people. The hostess are not friendly at all. Our server was overwhelmed to say the least. There are so many restaurants in Vegas, not worth your time waiting for this place. <br><br>As a side note: what restaurant runs out of Salmon on a Tuesday Night?

Love this place. Great food and great service. Highly recommend this place. Been there twice over two year&#39;s  and both times were great. Wait was reasonable to get a table both times. Got desert because it looked so good, had to take it to go, I was too full.

This is a must see if you&#39;re a Canadian. Every time we&#39;re in the States, we make it our mission to find a Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>The menu is huge and everything I&#39;ve ever tried is delicious. The portions are also huge and the price is extremely reasonable. Make sure to take a doggy bag because you MUST save room for dessert! Their cheesecake is heavenly! We had the Vanilla Bean Cheesecake and I&#39;ve never tasted something so delicious in my life. <br><br>The service is also always great here as well and they give you bread before your meal. <br><br>What more could you want in a restaurant. My only criticism is that they don&#39;t have any locations in Canada. I beg you Cheesecake Factory, please come to Canada!

I&#39;m not big on going to chain restaurants when in Vegas when there are so many great restaurants there. However it was getting late and I needed to get dinner at a place where I knew exactly what to what to order. Service was fast, but not too fast. I asked for only the whole wheat bread and they accommodated me.<br><br>The only downside to the place was that I got no signal at all on my phone. I wasn&#39;t the only one with that problem. That&#39;s not The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s fault, but it would be nice if they installed WiFi in the restaurant.

Despite being adamant that I did not want to sit at the tables outside the restaurant as the show was going on and carrying on a conversation would be impossible, the hostess assured me that this was the final two minutes of the show.  I again said that I was not happy with how noisy it was but was again assured the show was concluding.  After waiting for our beverages and sending back the cutlery that had old food on them, our dinner arrived.  As we considered another glass of wine or dessert the intolerable noise of the show started again. We instantly made our wine or dessert choice and stood to leave. As I searched for the hostess to get her explanation that after I obviously hadn&#39;t wanted to sit in the area while the show was on that she insisted but hadn&#39;t said it would restart in one hour she was nowhere to be found.

Standard CCF operation with super over whelming menu.  I get a huge headache after looking at everything.  Do i want one of their 20 salads, 20 burgers, 20 sandwiches, 50 apps?  You get the point.  There are hundreds of items on the menu.<br><br>I guess it&#39;s a &#34;safe&#34; option to take someone b/c you can find something for everyone.  The service was pretty slow on a Thurs late night.  Overall this location is what you would expect from Cheesecake.  The desserts are obv awesome and I like the firecracker salmon app.
Great place to rest your feet from shopping and awesome food. Classic burger hit the spot.

There&#39;s a Cheesecake factory closer to me, but I like the one on the Strip. It&#39;s more fun, more easy-going. Absolutely perfect for a get-together with a few friends. The menu is a phone book. I like that. This is one of the few restaurants that I&#39;ve tried different things. Also terrific for the kids. They are in heaven when we go. Good family restaurant. Window shop at the forum and then eat at the Cheesecake Factory.

Great lunch. The dishes was much over my expectations. I had the Bellagio chicken pasta which tasted great and my wife had the anti-oxidant salad which was not too bad. Cheesecakes here are all well made and we chose the original one which tasted slightly too cheesy to my taste.

Although not my first pick, my wife loves it. Food is always good....just not my fancy.  Service always spot on!! Extremely weird but for whatever reason, I&#39;ve only had cheesecake here a couple times. It&#39;s good for sure...but I wouldn&#39;t come here just for it. A good value and definitely a recommendation!!

I&#39;ll start with the customer service, unfortunately this is what makes it 3 stars.  We had a big group of around 15 people, and yes, they do not take reservations but we did call to let them know about when a 15 people group would be there.<br><br>Long story short, there was no table for us when we got there, which is fine, but the hostess was so rude and said it will be an hour and forty five min., she said there was only one table that would fit that many people, we asked if they could push a few tables outside together and she said no.<br><br>My coworker got a little upset and asked to talk o the manager, come to find out the wait was not going to be even close to that long and they would push two tables together for us.  So the 1 and 45 min wait time suddenly was only 15 min!!!<br><br>Our waitress was great, very sweet and nice.  We came here as a part of our company Christmas party and we work in a restaurant so we sometimes can be hard to make happy, especially our servers lol but she did great and there were no complaints!!!<br><br>Food. was. soooooooo. good !!!!!!!!!!!!! omg!!! everyone ate everything off their plates!!!  Fast hot fresh food, great portion sizes and fair prices!!!<br><br>I will def go back!!!

Who does not like this place? Cheese Cake Factory is always the place to go for good food. I love this location, the only complaint I have is the noise from the shops can be loud, but it is still a wonderful experience.
One of my favorite places to dine in！White chocolate raspberry truffle is the best ever!

We basically went to the Cheesecake Factory because we are addicted to two things: cheesecake and Big Bang Theory.<br><br>What a surprise! Not only you get an amazing choice of cheesecakes (and cakes in general) which are just delicious... but also the food is great! I&#39;ve tried the Smokehouse BBQ Burger twice and I have to admit it was one of the best I&#39;ve ever had and better than the one I had at Gordon Ramsay&#39;s BurGR the day before.<br><br>Definitely recommended (it&#39;s also non-expensive), but remember to show up early (or late) for dinner as the place is always packed!

Went here last night with a few friends around midnight (so they weren&#39;t busy at all) I was disappointed with the food first I ordered the Dynamite Shrimp the shrimp was WAY too over fried that I had to peel off the fried part and just eat the shrimp also the sauce that came with made me &amp; my husbands stomach hurt. We also ordered the Louisiana Pasta which we had to send back to the kitchen because there was almost no sauce on the pasta. Salads were good but I asked for the smallest caesar &amp;  she ended up bringing &amp; charging me for the bigger one. We had to ask for lemons for our water 4 times before finally getting them. I do love Cheesecake Factory but last night I wasn&#39;t happy with my experience.

When with family, shopping in Caesar&#39;s Forum this is the perfect choice!<br>The service excellent! As always in a Cheesecake Factory.<br>Anyone can find something they like on this giant menu! The food rock solid, not amazing, never terrible, but consistently good!

Great experience at this restaurant. The server was very nice and personable. We had to been been shrimp, calamari, and bite-size crabcakes.  There is a really nice aquarium right outside of the restaurant. So, while you wait you can look at the live fish.

Best to eat here if you don&#39;t mind waiting 1:30 for your meal (when you put the entire order in when you sat down) and you want to be called a liar by Joe the manager who says the meal was &#34;coursed out&#34;. Because we ordered drinks and an appetizer.   Like someone tell Joe he doesn&#39;t work at Spago and this shit ain&#39;t coursed out. And don&#39;t question how long we&#39;ve waited when we have proof we sat down at 8:30pm and still had no food at 10pm. Screw you, Joe the Manager. I&#39;ll give you a &#34;course&#34;....in customer service.

I dine here periodically after shopping at Caesars. Checked in with the receptionist, waited about 5 minutes before she took us back to a booth. The bred was freshly baked, straight out of the oven.. Still warm. The atmosphere is dimly lit and welcoming. The server was friendly and quick to fill up water. Our order came or fast and tasted fresh. I ordered the seared ahi tuna salad and it was soooo good!
The place is okay. If they get too busy then don&#39;t expect them to go back and fourth all around you. The food is good though.

We stumbled across the Cheesecake Factory amongst the general madness of the Caesar Forum shops and were very quickly seated as the rest of the line were larger groups than our two. The server was really friendly helpful and gave good tips on what to see and do in Las Vegas.<br><br>I&#39;m impressed that there were so many choices on the menu, it must be a logistical nightmare to maintain. I ordered pasta and meat sauce which was huge but as I was starving the whole lot was polished off quickly. Sadly this left no room for dessert.

Cheesecake Factory is a mandatory stop when in the USA, every place I travel and they have a CF I am there, the menu is huge, consistent, and satisfying. A Family pleaser! I always try new things but some favs include Steak Diane, Tuna Tartare, Chicken Madeira,.I try to save room for desert but never works, I have to get a slice of cheesecake to go,.cheesecake factory always hits the right spot, the portions are big, the prices are great, a must if you haven&#39;t tried before.

I think this location is one of their finest! <br>My wife and I went to dinner in the Christmas eve when we were in Vegas. The service was truly great. The atmosphere was fabulous. <br><br>I liked their interior design ... It looked little bit different from many Cheesecake Factory&#39;s locations. We ordered: <br><br>Caesar Salad: Good ... I have to say not like the ones in LA, but was good really. <br><br>Fried Shrimp platter: Mediocre in my opinion. I was expecting something much better than what it came that night to me! <br><br>Chicken Cajun: Much better than the Shrimp&#39;s, but also less than the expectations. <br><br>In all with the service and the design, it deserve 4 stars without hesitation.
We came to the restaurant around 7 and were given a 40 minutes wait time. We came back and were given more time to wait. We got our table and the food was average. Beware of the crowds.

Busy location but the surroundings are interesting enough to keep you busy while you wait for a table. Aquarium in the Caesar&#39;s Forum shopping centre is a good place to sit.<br><br>The wait for lunch was only 10 minutes and the service was friendly and quite helpful, with advice offered on customizing our orders - the advice turned out to be well worth it.  Our meals were served in a timely manner and they were delicious.  A very good Cheesecake Factory location that is worth visiting just for the surroundings. The standard Cheesecake Factory decor really blends well with the Roman setting of Caesar&#39;s Palace.<br><br>I know its a chain, but it is a good one with a great variety of tasty meals that allows you to satisfy everyone in your party with individual choices.
The Cuban sandwich was truly a treat. I don&#39;t know how they did it but a a masterpiece

This is my fourth time dinning at this location. Cheesecake Factory is obviously known for cheesecake, but also a variety of food and great service. I may be bias because I&#39;m a local to Summerlin Las Vegas, but this location lacks &#34;great service&#34; the food is sub par, and food wait times are extremely long . Like I said I live in Summerlin and the Boca Park location has exceptional service, the food quality is much higher and the time it takes to receive your food is shorter. Each time dinning here it&#39;s been an extremely long time before our food came. If you&#39;re a local definitely avoid this location at all cost, I suppose it&#39;s convenient for tourist.

The 3 different appetizers we got were VERY good. Tater Tots Fried Mac &amp; Cheese Avocado Egg-rolls, the sauce for the egg rolls was  delicious. Of course the bread  was good, my favorite was the honey wheat. The hostess were very nice and friendly. Our waiter was ok. However both dinner plates we got were  Eggplant Parmigiana with Pesto pasta &amp; the Shrimp /Sausage rigatoni pasta. We didn&#39;t have any dessert. If I would have liked either one of our dinner plates I&#39;d give it better star rating. Oh we sat outside and enjoyed the view of the large fish tank. Best seat in the house

I wasn&#39;t going to write a review for this place because it&#39;s not much different than any other cheesecake factory across the nation, which is to say a pretty good chain restaurant.  That said I would be remiss if I did not send a digital fist-bump to our waiter Jeff who was phenomenal.  I&#39;m sure that we aren&#39;t the first obnoxious drunk people who&#39;ve stumbled in here for late night grub but I doubt it ever gets easy to deal with and nobody does that better than Jeff.  He was a great sport, jumping in on our inside jokes, and provided top notch service.  There&#39;s certainly more prolific places to eat in Las Vegas, but you can do worse than the Caesar&#39;s Palace Cheesecake Factory.

The wait was less then 10 minutes even though it was dinner time and the crowd was wrapped around the waiting area!! Service was impeccable and the food was amazing. Sure thing if you want to enjoy your experience!!!
